Janet's ducks lay 16 eggs per day. She eats 3 for breakfast every day. She bakes muffins for her friends every day with 4. She sells the remainder at the farmers' market daily for $2 per fresh duck egg. So 16 - 3 - 4 = 9 eggs are sold at the farmers' market. 9 * 2 = 18 dollars. The answer is 18.

Q:

It takes 2 bolts of blue fiber and half that much white fiber. 2/2 + 1/2 = 3/2. The answer is 3/2.

Q:

Josh bought the house for $80,000. He put in $50,000 in repairs. That means he spent $50,000. 150% increase means that the new price is 1.5 times the old price. 1.5 * 80,000 = 120,000. So he made $120,000. The answer is 120,000.

Q:

James ran 60 meters each sprint 3 times a week. 3 * 60 = 180 meters. The answer is 180.

Q:

Wendi feeds her chickens 3 cups of mixed chicken feed per day. 15 cups in the morning, 25 cups in the afternoon, and 15 cups in the evening. 15 + 25 + 15 = 55 cups. 20 chickens eat 55 cups of food. The answer is 55.

Q:

Kylar needs to buy 16 glasses. Every second glass costs 60% of the price. So if one glass costs $5, then the second glass costs $5 / 2 = $2.50. 16 glasses cost $2.50 * 16 = $40. The answer is 40.

Q:

Toulouse has twice as many sheep as Charleston. Charleston has 4 times as many sheep as Seattle. So Toulouse has 2 * 4 = 8 more sheep than Charleston. Charleston has 4 * 2 = 8 more sheep than Seattle. So Toulouse has 8 + 8 = 16 more sheep than Seattle. The answer is 16.

Q:

Carla normally downloads 2 GB per minute. But when she was 40% into the download, Windows forced a restart to install updates, which took 20 minutes. So she had to restart the download from the beginning. 20 minutes is 20/60 = 1/3 of an hour. So she had to restart the download from the beginning 3 times. 20/3 = 6.666... GB. The answer is 6.666... GB.

Q:

John drove for 3 hours at 60 mph. Then he turned around and went back home. He spent the first 2 hours in standstill traffic. Then he drove at 30 mph for 30 minutes. Finally, he drove at 80 mph for the remaining 2 hours. 3 * 60 + 2 * 30 + 2 * 80 = 210 miles. The answer is 210 miles.

Q:

Eliza's rate per hour for the first 40 hours she works each week is $10. She also receives an overtime pay of 1.2 times her regular hourly rate. So if she worked for 45 hours this week, then her regular hourly rate would be 45 / 40 = 1.125. And her overtime pay would be 1.125 * 1.2 = 1.35. So her earnings for this week would be 10 * 40 + 1.35 * 5 = 450 + 67.5 = 517.5. The answer is 517.5.

Q:

In the first month, it had 60 downloads. In the second month, it had 3 times as many downloads as in the first month. That is 60 * 3 = 180 downloads. In the third month, it had 180 - 30% = 126 downloads. 60 + 180 + 126 = 366. The answer is 366.

Q:

Toula bought 3 dozen donuts for $68 per dozen. That is 3 * 68 = 204 dollars. She also bought 2 dozen mini cupcakes for $80 per dozen. That is 2 * 80 = 160 dollars. Finally, she bought 6 dozen mini cheesecakes for $55 per dozen. That is 6 * 55 = 330 dollars. So the total cost is 204 + 160 + 330 = 894 dollars. The answer is 894.

Q:

Carlos will spend $90 to plant the tree. Each year, it will grow 7 lemons. Each lemon sells for $1.5. So he will make $1.5 * 7 = 10.5 dollars per year. To cover the cost of watering and feeding the tree, he needs to spend $3 per year. So he will lose $3 per year. In total, he will lose $3 * 10 years = $30. So it will take him 10 years to start making money on the lemon tree. The answer is 10.

Q:

Melanie started with 5 vacuum cleaners. She sold a third of them at the green house. That is 5/3 = 1.666... vacuum cleaners. Then she sold 2 more to the red house. That is 2 + 1.666... = 3.666... vacuum cleaners. Finally, she sold half of what was left at the orange house. That is 5/2 = 2.5 vacuum cleaners. 5 - 1.666... - 3.666... - 2.5 = 0. So she has 0 vacuum cleaners left. The answer is 0.

Q:

20% of the original 20 students enrolled in contemporary dance. 25% of the remaining 16 students enrolled in jazz dance. The rest enrolled in hip-hop dance. So 20% of 20 is 4. 25% of 16 is 4. The rest enrolled in hip-hop dance. So 4 + 4 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q:

The merchant can choose either jewelry or electronic gadgets. If he chooses jewelry, it will be worth $5,000 + 2.5% = $5,075. If he chooses electronic gadgets, it will be worth $8,000 + 1.2% = $8,084. So if he chooses jewelry, he will get $5,075 - $5,000 = $75. If he chooses electronic gadgets, he will get $8,084 - $8,000 = $84. So the profit will be $75 - $84 = -$11. The answer is -$11.

Q:

The first day, they traveled 80 miles westward. The second day, they traveled 150 miles northward. 80 + 150 = 230 miles. The answer is 230.

Q:

Jill gets paid $20 per hour to teach and $30 to be a cheerleading coach. If she works 50 weeks a year, 35 hours a week as a teacher and 15 hours a week as a coach, then 50 * 35 * 20 + 50 * 15 * 30 = 12600 + 1500 = 14100. The answer is 14100.

Q:

Claire makes an omelet with 3 eggs every morning. In 4 weeks, she will make 4 * 3 = 12 omelets. 12 eggs will be used per omelet. So 12 * 3 = 36 eggs will be used in 4 weeks. The answer is 36.

Q:

Marissa walked 4 miles in an hour. Then she walked 2 miles in an hour. So she walked 4 + 2 = 6 miles in an hour. To get 4 miles per hour, she needs to walk 4 / 6 = 2/3 miles per hour. The answer is 2/3.

Q:

Q:

Q:

Q:

Marie ordered 1 chicken meal that costs $12. 5 packs of milk that costs $3 each. 4 apples that cost $1.50 each. And some boxes of pizza. Total cost is $50. 12 + 15 + 18 + 24 = 79. 79 - 50 = 29. The answer is 29.

Q:

Mishka spent 3 * 16.50 = 50.50 dollars on shorts. 3 * 22.50 = 67.50 dollars on pants. 3 * 42 = 126 dollars on shoes. 50.50 + 67.50 + 126 = 244 dollars. The answer is 244.

Q:

Cynthia eats one serving of ice cream every night.  She buys cartons of ice cream with 15 servings of ice cream per carton at a cost of $4.00 per carton.  After 60 days, she spent 60 * 4 = 240 dollars. The answer is 240.

Q:

Henry traveled 20 miles before stopping. Then he traveled 15 miles before stopping again. So he traveled 20 + 15 = 35 miles. The answer is 35.

Q:

Gloria's shoe budget was 33 dollars. One pair of heels cost 33 dollars. Another pair of heels cost 2 times 33 dollars = 66 dollars. Boots cost 33 dollars. So boots cost 33 - 66 = -33 dollars. The answer is -33.

Q:

Darrell and Allen's ages are in the ratio of 7:11. Their total age now is 162. 7/11 of 162 is 111. 111 + 10 = 121. The answer is 121.

Q:

Gunter asked his friends how many jelly beans they thought were in the jar. One said 80. Another said 20 more than half the first one. A third said 25% more than the first one. Their average guess was (80 + 20) / 3 = 100 / 3 = 33.33. The answer is 33.33.

Q:

John takes care of 10 dogs. Each dog takes .5 hours a day to walk and take care of their business. So 10 * .5 = 5 hours a day. 5 * 7 = 35 hours a week. The answer is 35.

Q:

Gretchen started with 110 coins. There are 30 more gold coins than silver coins. So 110 - 30 = 80 silver coins. 80 + 30 = 110 gold coins. The answer is 110.

Q:

Siobhan has 2 fewer jewels than Aaron. Aaron has 5 more jewels than half of Raymond's jewels. So if Raymond has 40 jewels, then Aaron has 40 + 5 = 45 jewels. Siobhan has 2 less than Aaron. 2 < 45. So Siobhan has 43 jewels. The answer is 43.

Q:

Mike played for 40 minutes. In the first 20 minutes, he scored 4 points. In the second 20 minutes, he scored 25% more points. 40 / 20 = 2. So he scored 4 + 2 * 25% = 4 + 5 = 9 points. The answer is 9.

Q:

Terry eats 2 yogurts a day. Each yogurt costs 4 dollars. So he spends 2 * 4 = 8 dollars per day. 8 * 30 = 240 dollars. The answer is 240.

Q:

John started with 13 lego sets. He sold them for $15 each. That was 13 * 15 = 195 dollars. He used 195 dollars to buy 8 video games for 20 dollars each. So he had 195 - 160 = 35 dollars left. 35 / 20 = 1.75. The answer is 1.75.

Q:

John runs 60 miles a week. He runs 3 days a week.  He runs 3 hours the first day and half as much the other two days he runs.  So he runs 3 * 3 = 9 miles the first day.  And he runs 3 * 1/2 = 1.5 miles the other two days.  So he runs 9 + 1.5 = 10.5 miles a week. 10.5 / 7 = 1.5 miles per day. The answer is 1.5 miles per day.

Q:

Dana can run at a rate of speed four times faster than she can walk. But she can skip at a rate of speed that is half as fast as she can run. So she can run at 4x speed and skip at ½ speed. 4x + ½ = 3. So she can run at 4x + ½ = 3 miles per hour. 3 miles per hour is equal to 3 miles per hour. So she can run at 3 miles per hour.

Q:

Brandon's iPhone is 4 times as old as Ben's iPhone. Ben's iPhone is 2 times older than Suzy's iPhone. So Brandon's iPhone is 4 * 2 = 8 times older than Suzy's iPhone. Suzy's iPhone is 1 year old. So Brandon's iPhone is 8 * 1 = 8 years old. The answer is 8.

Q:

The great dragon, Perg, sat high atop mount Farbo, breathing fire upon anything within a distance of 1000 feet.  Polly could throw the gold javelin, the only known weapon that could sleigh the dragon, for a distance of 400 feet, well within the reach of the dragon's flames.  But when Polly held the sapphire gemstone, she could throw the javelin three times farther than when not holding the gemstone.  When holding the gemstone, she can throw it 400 + 3(400) = 1200 feet away.  That is 1200 feet away from the dragon.  The answer is 1200.

Q:

Grandma Jones baked 5 apple pies. Each pie was cut into 8 pieces. So there were 5 * 8 = 40 pieces of pie. 40 - 14 is 26. The answer is 26.

Q:

A bag of chips has 250 calories per serving. 5 servings means 5 * 250 = 1250 calories. 1800 calories means 1800 / 2000 = 0.9. So we can eat 0.9 * 1250 = 1125 grams. The answer is 1125.

Q:

Charlie needs 10 pounds of beeswax to make 10 candles. 10 pounds of beeswax costs $10.00. Each candle costs $2.00. So he made 20 candles and sold them for $2.00 each. 20 * 2 = 40 dollars. His net profit is 40 - 10 = 30 dollars. The answer is 30.

Q:

Meredith wrote 5 articles on Monday. She wrote 2/5 times more articles on Tuesday than on Monday. So she wrote 2/5 * 5 = 2.5 articles on Tuesday. She wrote twice the number of articles she wrote on Tuesday on Wednesday. So she wrote 2 * 2.5 = 5 articles on Wednesday. In total, she wrote 5 + 2.5 + 5 = 12.5 articles. 12.5 hours is 12.5 / 4 = 3.125 hours. The answer is 3.125 hours.

Q:

Candice had 80 post-it notes in her purse. She bought a package of 23 post-it notes. She used 220 post-it notes at work. So she had 80 - 220 = 140 post-it notes left. 140 - 23 = 117. The answer is 117.

Q:

John bought twice as many red ties as blue ties. Red ties cost 50% more than blue ties. So if he spent $200 on blue ties, then he spent 2 * 1.5 = 3 times as much on red ties. 3 * 50 = 150. The answer is 150.

Q:

Tracy had a piece of wire 4 feet long. She cut it into pieces 6 inches long. 4 / 6 = 2/3. So she obtained 2/3 pieces. The answer is 2/3.

Q:

Richard lives in an apartment building with 15 floors. Each floor contains 8 units. 3/4 of the building is occupied. So 3/4 of 15 is 12. So there are 12 unoccupied units. The answer is 12.

Q:

Lloyd has an egg farm. Each day, his chickens produce 252 eggs. He sells them for $2 per dozen. So he makes $2 * 12 = 24 dollars per dozen. 24 * 252 is 6056 dollars per day. 6056 * 7 is 42328 dollars per week. The answer is 42328.

Q:

Q:

Q:

The mechanic charged $60 for each truck tire and $40 for each car tire. 6 truck tires and 4 car tires were repaired on Thursday. 12 car tires were repaired on Friday but no truck tires were repaired. 6 truck tires and 4 car tires cost $240. 12 car tires cost $480. 240 + 480 is 720. The answer is 720.

Q:

The Doubtfire sisters started with 7 kittens. Their mother called to say that Patchy had 3 times as many kittens as the Doubtfires. That means Patchy had 3 * 7 = 21 kittens. Trixie had 12 kittens. So the Doubtfires now have 21 + 12 = 33 kittens. The answer is 33.

Q:

Jean started with 30 lollipops. After eating 2, he had 30 - 2 = 28. He wanted to package 2 lollipops in one bag. So he had 28 / 2 = 14 bags. The answer is 14.

Q:

Peter has 42 dollars. He buys a ticket for 7 dollars and popcorn for 7 dollars. 42 / 7 = 6 times. The answer is 6.

Q:

Q:

Stephen placed an online order for groceries. His final bill came to $40.00. Because this was through a delivery vendor, they tacked on a 25% fee to his final total and charged him $3.00 in delivery fees. Stephen also added a $4.00 tip. After the extra fees, the final price of Stephen's groceries is $40.00 + (40.00 * 0.25) + 3.00 + 4.00 = 40.00 + 10.00 + 4.00 = 54.00. The answer is 54.

Q:

There are 6 clusters of 20 fruit each. Each cluster has 20 fruits. So there are 6 clusters * 20 fruits = 120 fruits. There are also 67 individual fruits scattered across the bush. 67 + 120 = 187 fruits. The answer is 187.

Q:

Q:

Q:

So she got 2% of the value of the pension per year. In the next 10 years, she got 5% of the value of the pension per year. So in the next 10 years, she got 5% of 30 years worth of pension. 5% of 30 is 1.5%. So she got 1.5% of the value of the pension per year. So in total, she got 2% + 1.5% = 3.5% of the value of the pension per year. 50,000/year * 3.5% = 1,750 dollars per year. The answer is 1,750 dollars per year.

Q:

The answer is 133.

Q:

Q:

Q:

John adopted a dog. He took it to the groomer, which costs $100. The groomer offered him a 30% discount for being a new customer. So the grooming cost is $100 * (100 / 130) = $100 * 0.76923076923076923 = $76.92. The answer is 76.92.

Q:

Q:

Q:

Grace weighs 125 pounds. Alex weighs 2 pounds less than 4 times what Grace weighs. 125 * 4 = 460 pounds. 460 - 2 = 458 pounds. The answer is 458.

Q:

Q:

Q:

Q:

Greg's alarm rings 3 times a day. It rang 4 times the first time. It rang for 3 times longer than the first time. It rang for half as long as the second time. So it rang 4 + (3 * 2) + (3 / 2) = 12 times. The answer is 12.

Q:

Sylvie was paid $600 per month. Every year, her salary would increase by 10%. So if she stayed for 5 years, her salary would increase by 50%. 600 * (1.1) ^ 5 = 1050. The answer is 1050.

Q:

Marilyn's first record sold 10 times as many copies as Harald's. So if they sold 88,000 copies combined, then Marilyn's first record sold 88,000 / 10 = 8,800 copies. Harald sold 88,000 - 8,800 = 79,200 copies. The answer is 79,200.

Q:

Christina needs .75 gift bags per invited guest. So if she invites 16 guests, she needs 16 * .75 = 12 gift bags. Each gift bag costs $2. So 12 * 2 = 24 dollars. The answer is 24.

Q:

Ted needs to bring 20 * 10 = 200 pounds of potato salad. The answer is 200.

Q:

Jan has three times the number of pets as Marcia. Marcia has two more pets than Cindy. So if Cindy has 4 pets, then Jan has 3 * 4 = 12 pets. Marcia has 2 more pets than Cindy. So Marcia has 4 + 2 = 6 pets. So Jan has 12 pets and Marcia has 6 pets. The answer is 12 + 6 = 18.

Q:

Amy is 5 years older than Jackson. Jackson is 2 years younger than Corey. Corey is 10 years old. James is 1 year younger than Corey. So Jackson is 10 - 2 = 8 years old. The answer is 8.

Q:

Lee could run the 400-meter hurdles in 38 seconds. Gerald's original time was 40 seconds. So Gerald's new time is 40 - (10% of 40) = 36 seconds. The answer is 36.

Q:

There are 12 fewer rabbits than the combined number of pet dogs and cats. If there are 2 cats for every dog, and the number of dogs is 60, then there are 2 * 60 = 120 cats. 120 - 12 = 108 rabbits. The answer is 108.

Q:

Out of 200 Grade 5 students, 2/5 are boys. 2/3 of the girls are in the girl scout. So 2/5 + 2/3 = 1. 1/5 of the girls are not in the girl scout. The answer is 1.

Q:

Harry slept 9 hours. James slept 2/3 of what Harry slept. 9 / (2/3) is 9 * 3 = 27. So Harry slept 9 more hours than James. The answer is 9.

Q:

Freda used 16 ounce cans of tomatoes. Each can contained 3 tomatoes. So 16 cans contain 16 * 3 = 48 tomatoes. 48 tomatoes make 32 ounces of sauce. 48 / 32 = 1.5. The answer is 1.5.

Q:

There were originally 30 cars on the motorway. In the first 15 minutes, 20 more cars drove through. 30 + 20 = 50. The answer is 50.

Q:

Mary started with 18 new potted plants. She already had 2 potted plants on each of the 40 window ledges. So she had 18 + 40 = 58 potted plants. She gave away 1 potted plant from each ledge. So she had 58 - 40 = 18 potted plants remaining. The answer is 18.

Q:

Jerome had 4 friends. The first friend pressed on the doorbell 20 times. The second friend pressed on the doorbell 20 + 1/4 = 25 times. The third friend pressed on the doorbell 25 + 10 = 35 times. The fourth friend pressed on the doorbell 35 + 60 = 95 times. 20 + 25 + 35 + 95 = 175. The answer is 175.

Q:

Solo needs to read 4 pages from his Science textbook, 20 pages from his Social Studies textbook, 7 pages from his History textbook and 8 pages from his Geography textbook. He read 15 pages on Monday. If he has 4 more days to complete all his reading, then he has 4 more days. 4 * 4 = 16 days. So he needs to read 16 pages per day. The answer is 16.

Q:

John drinks a glass of water with breakfast, lunch and dinner. That is 3 times a day. 3 * 7 = 21. Then he also drinks one before going to bed. 21 + 1 = 22. The answer is 22.

Q:

The fog bank covers 3 miles every 10 minutes. So it will take 42 / 3 = 14 hours. The answer is 14.

Q:

Poppy started with 1000 pieces. She placed a quarter of them on the board. That is 250 pieces. Her mom placed a third of the remaining pieces. That is 333 pieces. So there are 250 + 333 = 583 pieces left to be placed. The answer is 583.

Q:

Cody eats 3 times as many cookies as Amir. So if Amir eats 5 cookies, Cody will eat 3 * 5 = 15 cookies. The answer is 15.

Q:

John has 3 boxes. Each box is 5 inches by 6 inches by 4 inches. The walls are 1 inch thick. So the total inner volume of all 3 boxes is 5 * 6 * 4 * 1 = 120 cubic inches. The answer is 120.

Q:

Frankie watched 7 hours of TV in all. On Monday and Tuesday, he watched 1 hour each night. On Wednesday, he watched 30 minutes each night. On Thursday, he watched 1 hour and 30 minutes. On Friday, he watched 2 hours. 7 / 3 = 2.33. So he watched 2.33 * 30 = 69.9 minutes of 30 minute shows on Wednesday. The answer is 69.9.

Q:

Henry wanted to make twice as many cookies as he made last year. So he made 2x as many cookies as last year. 2x as many cookies as last year is 2 * 110 = 220. The answer is 220.

Q:

Gas costs $3 per gallon. Cashback is $.20 per gallon. 10 gallons is 10 * 3 = 30 dollars. Cashback is 30 * .20 = 6 dollars. The answer is 36 dollars.

Q:

Marcell's was 3 wide and 14 long. Beatrice's was 2 wide and 24 long. So if they both ate their entire amount, it would be 3 * 14 = 42 for Marcell and 2 * 24 = 48 for Beatrice. 42 + 48 = 90. The answer is 90.

Q:

Julia's boat sprang a leak while she was out on the lake. The boat was taking on two liters of water for every ten feet she rowed back towards shore. It took her sixteen seconds to row twenty feet. The shore was 64 seconds away. So it took 64/16 = 4 times as long to reach the shore. So the boat took on 4 * 2 = 8 liters of water. The answer is 8.

Q:

Q:

The tank was initially filled with 120 liters of water. Celine used 90 liters of water from the tank to water her small garden. So the tank had 120 - 90 = 30 liters of water left. Then she collected rainwater that is twice as much as what was left. 30 * 2 = 60 liters of water. So the tank now has 60 liters of water. The answer is 60.

Q:

Andy planted 90 geraniums. He planted 40 fewer petunias than geraniums. 90 - 40 = 50 petunias. So he planted 90 + 50 = 140 flowers total. The answer is 140.

Q:

The company spent $15000 for one year. Then it spent a third of that amount for another year. So it spent 15000/3 = 5000 for the second year. So the total amount spent was 15000 + 5000 = 20000. The answer is 20000.

Q:

Carlos rented the canoe for 3 hours. Benji rented the raft for 5 hours. So they paid 30 * 3 = 90 dollars and 18 * 5 = 90 dollars. They paid 90 + 90 = 180 dollars. The answer is 180.

Q:

Andrew plans to go to Rochester by bus and return from Rochester by car. So it will take him 6 days to travel by bus and half as many days to travel by car. 6 + (half of 6) = 12. The answer is 12.

Q:

James started with 30 fire type, 20 grass type, and 40 water type. He lost 8 of the water type and bought 14 grass type. So he had 30 - 8 = 22 fire types, 20 - 8 = 12 grass types, and 40 - 14 = 26 water types. 22 / 30 = 0.73, 12 / 20 = 0.6, and 26 / 40 = 0.65. So the answer is 0.65.

Q:

Chad's original bill was $6.50 + 2 * $2.00 + 1 * $1.00 + 2 * $0.25 + $3.00. This is $14.50. His gift card was $5.00. So he owes $9.50. The answer is 9.50.

Q:

Kalinda can add 4 pieces per minute. Her mom can add half as many pieces per minute. So her mom can add 2 pieces per minute. 360 / 4 = 90 minutes. 90 / 2 = 45 minutes. The answer is 45 minutes.

Q:

The original number of watermelons was 120. After 2 months, 30% of them were ready. That means 30% of 120 is 36. So 36 were taken away. After another 2 weeks, 3/4 of the remaining 84 were ready. That means 3/4 of 84 is 66. So 66 were taken away. The answer is 66.

Q:

Mark bought 12 cars. Each car cost $20,000. He paid 10% tax on the cars and then another $1000 for registration on each of them. So 12 * (20000 + 1000) = 240000. The answer is 240000.

Q:

Kylie collected 5 more shells than Robert on Monday. Then she collected 2 times more shells than she did on Monday. So she collected 5 + 2 = 7 more shells on Tuesday. The answer is 7.

Q:

Dax went to their farm to pick some apples and found half as many bugs as ants in the garden. If there were 50 ants, then there were 50 / 2 = 25 bugs. The answer is 25.

Q:

There were originally 36 penguins. 1/3 of them went into the water. 1/3 of them went into the cave. So 1/3 + 1/3 = 2/3. 2/3 of 36 is 24. So there are 36 - 24 = 12 penguins left. The answer is 12.

Q:

Steve eats 6 tomatoes per day. His girlfriend eats 3 tomatoes per day. 6 / 3 = 2. So Steve needs 2 times as many vines as his girlfriend. 2 * 3 = 6. The answer is 6.

Q:

John has 20 friends. Each friend needs 4 slices. 20 * 4 = 80 slices. 80 / 8 = 10 pizzas. The answer is 10.

Q:

Ram used 25 pens. When the ink ran out, he mixed the ink from 5 pens to make one full pen. So he made 5 pens. The answer is 5.

Q:

Johnny started with 20 dollars. He added an extra 10 dollars. That is 30 dollars. Then he invested that 30 dollars, which tripled to 90 dollars. The answer is 90.

Q:

Mary is 2 years younger than Joan. Joan is 5 years older than Jessa. So Joan is 7 years older than Mary. Jessa is 20 years old. 20 - 7 = 13. The answer is 13.

Q:

There were 1000 students in the hall. 30% of them went out through exit A. 3/5 of the remaining went out through exit B. The rest went out through exit C. So 30% of 1000 is 300. 3/5 of 1000 is 600. 1000 - 600 is 400. 400 went out through exit C. The answer is 400.

Q:

James has 6 more candies than Robert. John has twice as many candies as Robert. So if John has 54 candies, then Robert has 54 / 2 = 27 candies. 27 + 6 = 33. The answer is 33.

Q:

Dolly has two books. Pandora has one book. They will read each other's books as well as their own. So they will read 2 + 1 = 3 books. The answer is 3.

Q:

Mike was a pen pal with 5 people. He stopped being penpals with 2 of them. Each person sends 2 letters a week that are 5 pages long. He responds in kind. He can write a page every 6 minutes. 5 * 2 * 6 = 60 minutes. 60 / 6 = 10 hours. The answer is 10 hours.

Q:

Jason has a phone plan of 1000 minutes per month. Every day he has a 15-minute call with his boss, and he's had 300 extra minutes of call this month to other people. 1000 / 30 = 33.33 minutes per day. 33.33 * 30 = 1000 minutes. 1000 - 300 = 700 minutes. The answer is 700.

Q:

Griffin had 24 fries. Kyle took 5 of them. Billy took twice as many as Kyle. Ginger gave Griffin a handful of her fries, and then Colby took from Griffin 3 less than the number of fries that Kyle had taken. In the end, Griffin had 27 fries. 24 + 5 - 2 = 27. The answer is 27.

Q:

There are 4 snails in one aquarium. In another aquarium, there are 32 snails. The difference between the two aquariums is 32 - 4 = 28. Twice the amount of fish in both aquariums is 28 * 2 = 56. So there are 56 fish in each aquarium. The answer is 56.

Q:

Jeans makeup artist charges her $250 an hour.  She requires very expensive makeup for a movie she is in and it takes 6 hours to do each day and she needs it done 4 times a week.  The movie takes 5 weeks to finish.  After the movie is done the makeup artist gives Jean a 10% discount because of the amount of work done.  So 250 * 6 * 4 * 5 = 15000. 15000 * 0.1 = 1500. 1500 + 1500 = 3000. The answer is 3000.

Q:

Isabelle spent $12 on ingredients for the cake, $43 on birthday presents, $15 on decorations, $4 on invitations, and $22 on goodie bags for the party guests. She split the cost evenly three ways with her two parents. So each parent paid $12 + $43 + $15 + $4 + $22 = 94 dollars. The answer is 94.

Q:

The chef bought 4 bags of onions. Each bag weighs 50 pounds. A pound of onions costs $1.50. 4 * 50 = 200 pounds. 200 * 1.50 = 300 dollars. The answer is 300.

Q:

Sue ate 4 times as many cookies as her sister on Monday. That means she ate 4 * 5 = 20 cookies. On Tuesday, she ate twice as many cookies as her sister. That means she ate 2 * 13 = 26 cookies. Her sister ate 5 cookies on Monday and 13 the next day. So she ate 5 + 13 = 18 cookies. 20 + 26 + 18 = 64. The answer is 64.

Q:

There are 3 classes. In total, there are 20 students per class. 50% of 20 is 10. 10 is the number of boys in the third class. The answer is 10.

Q:

Travis started with 61 apps. He deleted 9 apps and downloaded 18 more. 61 - 9 = 52. 52 + 18 = 70. The answer is 70.

Q:

Last night, Rick killed 10 wolves and 15 cougars. Today, he killed 3 times as many wolves as cougars and 3 fewer cougars than the previous night. So he killed 3 * 10 = 30 wolves and 12 cougars. The answer is 30 + 12 = 42.

Q:

Bill started on the 3rd floor. He rode the elevator up to the floor that's equal to 4 times his starting floor plus 6. 3 * 4 + 6 = 13. So Bill is on the 13th floor. The answer is 13.

Q:

Mitchell went down the water slide 30 times. Anne went down the slide 30% less than Mitchell. So 30% of 30 is 9. Anne went down the slide 9 times. Robert went down the slide 4 times as much as Anne. So 4 * 9 = 36. Robert went down the slide 36 times. The answer is 36.

Q:

There were originally 10 stalls with 20 cows each. Mr. Sylas bought 40 cows and divided them equally, putting an equal number of the new cows into each of the twenty stalls. So 40 / 20 = 2. So 20 / 2 = 10. So 10 stalls had 20 cows each. 40 / 10 = 4. So 4 new cows went into each of the remaining 8 stalls. The answer is 4.

Q:

Q:

Nancy owes 8 books for 0.50 cents each. That is 8 x 0.50 = 4 dollars. In addition, she has to pay a flat $2.00 fee for having at least one book that's over a week overdue. So 4 + 2 = 6 dollars. The answer is 6 dollars.

Q:

Andrea has 8 more apples than Jamal. Half as many bananas as Jamal means that she has 2 fewer bananas than Jamal. 52 apples + 2 fewer bananas + 4 more bananas = 52 + 2 - 4 = 50. The answer is 50.

Q:

To make 36 cookies, you need 2 cups of flour. To make 30 cookies, you need 2 cups of flour. So you need 2 cups of flour for 36 cookies and 2 cups of flour for 30 cookies. 2 * 2 = 4 cups of flour. The answer is 4.

Q:

There are 9,300 pennies in a cup. Two thirds of this is 9,300 / 3 = 3,100 pennies. 3,100 pennies is worth $31. The answer is $31.

Q:

Maddison started with 5 boxes with 50 marbles in each box. Then she got 20 marbles from her friend. 5 * 50 = 250 marbles. 250 - 20 = 230 marbles. The answer is 230.

Carmen had 100 dollars. Samantha had 125 dollars. Daisy had 150 dollars. So their combined amount is 100 + 125 + 150 = 475. The answer is 475.

Q:

Mrs. Cruz has a budget of $400 000. The selling price of the house is $350 000. The brokerage fee is 5% of the selling price. The transfer fee is 12% of the selling price. So the total price of the house is $350 000 + (5/100) * $350 000 + (12/100) * $350 000 = $350 000 + $1750 + $42000 = $48 000. The answer is $48 000.

Q:

Mr. Tan sold his house for $400 000. Transfer fees are 3% of the selling price. Brokerage fees are 5% of the selling price. He also paid $250 000 for the remaining loan amount of the house. So he paid $400 000 - (3% of $400 000) - (5% of $400 000) - $250 000 = $390 000. The answer is $390 000.

Q:

It takes 20 minutes for the oil to heat up to 300 degrees.  It then takes 40% longer for the oil to heat up to the desired temperature of 400 degrees.  After warming the oil it takes 5 minutes less time to cook than it took to warm up the oil.  So 20 + (40/100) * 20 = 20 + 8 = 28 minutes. The answer is 28 minutes.

Q:

The real estate agent spent $5 on each newspaper ad and $75 on each television ad. 50 newspapers ads cost $5 * 50 = 250 dollars. 15 television ads cost $75 * 15 = 1125 dollars. So the total cost is 250 + 1125 = 1375 dollars. The answer is 1375.

Q:

A juggler can juggle 16 balls.  Half of them are golf balls.  Half of those are blue.  So there are 16 / 2 = 8 golf balls.  Of those, 8 / 2 = 4 are blue. The answer is 4.

Q:

Mary bought 3 bags of M&Ms. The first bag had 300 M&Ms. The second bag had 12 more M&Ms than the first. The third bag had a hole in it, so it only had half the number of M&Ms that the first bag had. So the third bag had 150 M&Ms. 300 + 12 + 150 = 562 M&Ms. The answer is 562.

Q:

John has 2 houses with 3 bedrooms each. Each bedroom has 2 windows each. There are an additional 4 windows in each house not connected to bedrooms. So there are 2 * 3 + 4 = 10 windows in each house. 2 * 10 = 20 windows in total. The answer is 20.

Q:

The mother paid $20. She bought cocoa for $4.20, laundry for $9.45 and a package of pasta for $1.35. So she spent $20 - (4.20 + 9.45 + 1.35) = 1.05. The answer is 1.05.

Q:

Terri's sweater has 2 sleeves, a collar, and a decorative rosette. The body of the sweater takes 900 stitches to complete. The collar takes a tenth of that number of stitches, so it takes 90 stitches. The rosette takes twice as many as the collar, so it takes 180 stitches. The whole sweater is an 1800-stitch project. So each sleeve takes 1800 / 2 = 900 stitches. The answer is 900.

Q:

Mrs. Rylan bought 20 packets of tomato seeds and 80 packets of celery seeds. Each packet of tomato seeds cost $40. Each packet of celery seeds cost $30. 20 * 40 = 800. 80 * 30 = 2400. 800 + 2400 = 3200. The answer is 3200.

Q:

Sean has to memorize 54 lines in the lyrics. The first scene has twice the number of lines, but only a third of them are his lines. The second scene has six more lines than the song, and four-fifths of them are his. 54 + (2 * 3/5) + 6 + (4/5) = 54 + 6 + 4 = 64. The answer is 64.

Q:

Carly had 80 cards. 2/5 of the cards had the letter A on them. 1/2 of the remaining had the letter B. 5/8 of the rest had the letter C. And the others had the letter D. 2/5 + 1/2 + 5/8 + 1 = 10/24. 10/24 is 1/2. So 1/2 of the cards had the letter D. The answer is 1/2.

Q:

Matthew took 3 minutes to dig a small hole and 10 minutes to dig a large hole. 30 small holes and 15 large holes will be 30 * 3 + 15 * 10 = 105 minutes. The answer is 105.

Q:

Mico and Marco's ages are 20. In 10 years, they will both be 30. 20 + 30 = 50. The answer is 50.

Q:

Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age. Sam is 2/3 of Ruby's age.

Peter paid 20 * 0.25 = 5 dollars for 20 popsicles. He paid 4 * 0.50 = 2 dollars for 4 ice cream bars. So he paid 5 + 2 = 7 dollars. The answer is 7.

Q:

Cobra has 70 spots. Mamba has 35 spots. So the total number of spots is 70 + 35 = 105. Half of 105 is 52.5. The answer is 52.5.

Q:

Maddy is buying pizzas for 12 team members and 3 coaches. Each team member brings 2 guests. A pizza serves 3 people. 12 + 3 + 2 * 3 = 42 people. 42 * 15 = 630 dollars. The answer is 630.

Q:

Katerina used 8 topaz gemstones per necklace. Each topaz gemstone was 1 inch long. Sterling silver beads were 1/4 inch long. So 8 * 1 = 8 topaz gemstones. 8 * 1/4 = 2 sterling silver beads. The answer is 2.

Q:

Alani wrote 20 stories in the first week. Her brother Braylen wrote 40 stories in the first week. Her sister Margot wrote 60 stories in the first week. In the second week, they each doubled the number of stories they'd written in the first week. So Alani wrote 20 + 20 = 40 stories in the second week. Her brother Braylen wrote 40 + 40 = 80 stories in the second week. Her sister Margot wrote 60 + 60 = 120 stories in the second week. So in total, Alani wrote 40 + 40 + 20 = 100 stories. Her brother Braylen wrote 80 + 80 + 40 = 200 stories. Her sister Margot wrote 120 + 120 + 60 = 300 stories. So in total, they wrote 100 + 200 + 300 = 600 stories. The answer is 600.

Q:

Ann is 9 years old. Her brother is twice her age. So her brother is 18 years old. In 3 years, her brother will be 18 + 3 = 21 years old. The answer is 21.

Q:

Kelly started with 5 quarters and 2 dimes. If she buys a can of pop for 55 cents, then she will have 55 cents left. 55 cents is 5 quarters and 2 dimes. So she will have 5 quarters and 2 dimes left. The answer is 5 quarters and 2 dimes.

Q:

There are 76 stars in total. 76 / 8 = 9. 76 / 6 = 12. 76 / 5 = 15. 9 + 12 + 15 = 36. The answer is 36.

Q:

The delivery trucks can carry a total weight of 2000 pounds. 80 flagstones weigh 80 * 75 = 6000 pounds. So 6000 / 2000 = 3. So 3 trucks will be needed. The answer is 3.

Q:

The car in the fast lane was going 60 miles per hour. The car in the slow lane was going half as fast, or 30 miles per hour. The car in the fast lane went 480 miles. 480 / 60 = 8 hours. The car in the slow lane went 480 miles in 8 hours. The answer is 60 minutes.

Q:

Ali has 22 medals. Izzy has 5 less medals. 22 + 5 = 27. They have 10 times less medals than have been given out for counting. 27 * 10 = 270. The answer is 270.

Q:

There are 4 adults and 8 children. Each adult gets 6 chocolate bars. That leaves 8 - 6 = 2 chocolate bars per child. The answer is 2.

Q:

Susan earns $5 every 10 minutes. She worked for 3 hours. 3 hours * 10 minutes per hour = 30 minutes. 30 minutes / 10 minutes per hour = 3 rounds. 3 rounds * 5 dollars per round = 15 dollars. The answer is 15 dollars.

Q:

Mike had 21 points. Jim had 18 points. Tony had 42 points. In the fourth round, Mike got 1 point, Jim got 1 point, and Tony got 2 points. So Mike had 22 points, Jim had 19 points, and Tony had 44 points. The answer is 44.

Q:

Will bought 15 oranges. His oldest son is 8 years old. His youngest son is half as old as the oldest. So the youngest son is 4 years old. 15 oranges / 2 sons = 7.5 oranges per son. 8 + 4 = 12.5 oranges. 12.5 - 7.5 = 5 oranges. The answer is 5.

Q:

Darren did 100 pushups, 50 squats, and 20 dumbbell presses on the first day. On the second day, he did 20 more pushups than on the first day, 10 fewer squats, and doubled the number of dumbbell presses. 100 + 20 + 20 + 10 + 2 = 152. The answer is 152.

Q:

Each person consumes 0.2 kg of rice every meal. 5 people consume 0.2 kg * 5 = 1 kg of rice every meal. 1 kg / 42 kg = 0.024. 0.024 weeks is 1 week. The answer is 1 week.

Q:

Sam's target is 120 crates. He was closed on Monday and Friday. Over the weekend he sold 20 crates. On Tuesday he sold 15 crates, on Wednesday 12 crates, and Thursday 18 crates. 120 - (Monday + Friday) - (Saturday + Sunday) - (Tuesday + Wednesday + Thursday) = 120 - 2 - 2 - 3 = 115. The answer is 115.

Q:

Carmen starts with $200. Each time she bids, it rises by $50. So she ends up paying $200 + 3 * 50 = 350. The answer is 350.

Q:

John's work is 30 miles away. He goes there and back each day. 5 days a week for 50 weeks a year.  So it is 30 miles * 5 days * 50 weeks = 1500 miles.  He pays $2 per mile. So 1500 * 2 = 3000 dollars.  And he gives his driver a $150 bonus per month.  So 12 months * 150 dollars = 1800 dollars.  So he pays 3000 + 1800 = 4800 dollars a year. The answer is 4800.

Q:

Peter wanted to exercise for twice the amount of time he did on Monday and Sunday combined. So if he did 23 + 16 = 39 minutes on Monday and Sunday combined, then he needed to do 39 * 2 = 78 minutes on Tuesday. The answer is 78.

Q:

A tabloid is 32 pages long. It is printed on both sides. So it needs 32 / 2 = 16 pages. The answer is 16.

Q:

Annika brought 50 dollars. Half of it was spent on food and snacks. That is 50 / 2 = 25. Another 10 dollars was spent on rides. 25 + 10 = 35. The answer is 35.

Q:

Elise started with 250 books. In the first year, she sold 250/2 = 125 books. In the second year, she sold 125/2 = 62.5 books. In the third year, she sold 62.5/2 = 31.25 books. So she sold 31.25 books in the third year. 31.25 * 20 = 625 dollars. The answer is 625.

Q:

Watson works 10 hours a day, 5 days a week. That is 10 * 5 = 50 hours a week. 50 * 10 = 500 dollars. Then he gets a $300 bonus each week if the company performs well. 500 + 300 = 800 dollars. The answer is 800.

Q:

John arm wrestled 20 people. 80% means that he beat 8 out of 10 people. 8 / 10 is 4 / 5. So he lost to 4 / 5 of them. The answer is 4 / 5.

Q:

In the morning, 2/3 of the loaves are sold. That is 2/3 * 60 = 40 loaves. In the afternoon, half of the remaining loaves are sold. That is 1/2 * (40 + 30) = 20 loaves. The answer is 20.

Q:

Sandy wants to lose as much weight as Joey does but needs 4 weeks to lose the same amount of weight that Joey loses in a single week. So if Joey loses 8 pounds in 4 weeks, then Sandy needs 8 / 4 = 2 weeks to lose the same amount of weight. The answer is 2.

Q:

A tub of ice cream costs $13. It is now sold at $11. So it is cheaper by $2. 2 * 4 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q:

Helena's serum will make the drinker grow an extra arm every three days and an extra leg every five days. After 15 days, the drinker will have 15 * 3 = 45 arms and legs. The answer is 45.

Q:

Theo has 6000 dollars. He spent 6000 - 1800 = 4200 dollars. He saved 4200 - 2000 = 2200 dollars. The answer is 2200.

Q:

In a family of 5, 3 people eat 3 eggs each day. The other 2 people eat 2 eggs each day. So 3 * 3 + 2 * 2 = 15 eggs. They eat eggs every day, so 15 * 7 = 105 eggs. The answer is 105.

Q:

Trent is 5 years older than Jane. Jane is 3 years younger than Quinn. So Trent is 5 + 3 = 8 years older than Quinn. Quinn is 30. 8 + 3 = 11. The answer is 11.

Q:

Six years ago, Noah was half as old as Cera. So Noah was 1/2 of Cera's age. 1/2 of 46 is 23. So Noah was 23 years old. 3000 times 23 is 69000. So the population of Chile six years ago was 69000. Now, Cera is 46 years old. 46 - 23 is 23. So the population of Chile now is 69000 + 23 = 70233. The answer is 70233.

Q:

There are 105 members in the football team.  Offense has twice as many players as defense. Defense has half the number of players as special teams. 105 / 2 = 52. 52 / 2 = 26. 26 / 2 = 13. 13 / 2 = 6. 6 / 2 = 3. 3 / 2 = 1.5. 1.5 / 2 = 0.75. 0.75 * 2 = 1.5. 1.5 * 2 = 3. The answer is 3.

Q:

Martha invited 2 families with 6 people and 3 families with 4 people. 8 people couldn't come due to illness, and 1/4 that number had previous commitments. So 2 * 6 + 3 * 4 - 8 - 1/4 * (2 * 6 + 3 * 4) = 2 * 6 + 3 * 4 - 8 - 1/4 * 12 = 2 * 6 + 3 * 4 - 8 - 3 = 14. The answer is 14.

Q:

Solomon started with 20 marbles. His father gave him 2/5 times as many marbles as he bought from Johanna. That means he got 2/5 * 20 = 10 marbles. So he had 20 + 10 = 30 marbles. Then he added 50 more. 30 + 50 = 80. The answer is 80.

Q:

John filled a 6 foot by 4 foot pool that is 5 feet deep.  It costs $.1 per cubic foot to fill.  So 6 * 4 * 5 = 120 cubic feet. 120 * $.1 = 12 dollars. The answer is 12 dollars.

Q:

We know that there are 3 times as many girls as boys. So we can say that there are 3 boys for every girl. 30 / 3 = 10. So there are 10 boys and 10 girls. Then there are 10 * 10 = 100 children. The answer is 100.

Q:

The ratio of the electric poles and electric wires needed to connect and supply the electricity in a certain neighborhood is 1:3. If the total number of electric wires needed to connect the electricity in the neighborhood is 45, then the total number of electric poles required by an electric company to supply the electricity in the neighborhood is 45 / 3 = 15. The answer is 15.

Q:

At the beginning of the party, there were 25 men and 15 women. After an hour, 1/4 of the total number of people left. So 25 + 15 = 40 people left. 22 men stayed at the party. So 40 - 22 = 18 women are left. The answer is 18.

Q:

A magazine costs half as much as a book. The book costs $4. A pen costs $1 less than a magazine. So a pen costs $4 - 1 = 3 dollars. The answer is 3.

Q:

Jam had 3 boxes full of pencils and 2 loose pencils. That gives a total of 26 pencils. Meg had 46 pencils. So Jam and Meg needed 46 - 26 = 20 boxes. The answer is 20.

Q:

Shannon starts with 13 degrees cooler coffee. Adding 15 milliliters of cream will make it 15 milliliters weaker. Cooling it by 65 degrees will make it 65 - 13 = 52 milliliters weaker. 15 + 52 is 67 milliliters weaker. The answer is 67.

Q:

Ralph has a record store where people can trade their own records for new ones. People can trade 2 old records for 1 new one. 5 people came in with old records and left with 7 new records between them. 5 * 2 = 10 old records. The answer is 10.

Q:

There are 100 employees. 2/5 of them are junior programmers. They are paid $2000 each. So 2/5 * 100 * 2000 = 40000. The answer is 40000.

Q:

There were 20 people going to the third stop. At the first bus stop, 5 more people got in. At the second bus stop, 7 people got down and 8 more got in. So at the second bus stop, 12 people got in. 20 - 12 is 8. The answer is 8.

Q:

Oscar started with 24 lollipops. He ate 2 on his way to school. He passed 14 out to his friends. He bought twice as many lollipops on his way home as he gave to his friends. He ate 3 more that night and 2 more in the morning. So he had 24 - 2 - 14 + 2 * 2 = 24 - 14 + 4 = 10 lollipops. The answer is 10.

Q:

The cell-phone recharges at the rate of 1 percentage-point of charge per 3 minutes. So if it is at 60%, then it took 60/3 = 20 minutes to get to 60%. So it will take 20 * 3 = 60 minutes to fully charge. The answer is 60.

Q:

Erin started with 7 lollipops. Her mother gave her 10 more. So she had 7 + 10 = 17 lollipops. After giving 3 to Ella, she had 17 - 3 = 14 lollipops. The answer is 14.

Q:

The customer's loyalty card gives them rewards of $1 off their next purchase for every $20 they spend. They spent $80 on their last shopping trip. That means they received $80 - $20 = 60 rewards. On this shopping trip, they spent $43, used their rewards, and applied a coupon that took twice the amount of rewards off the price. 43 - 60 = -17. The answer is -17.

Q:

Nick's first job pays $15 per hour for 2000 hours a year. That is $15 * 2000 = $30,000. His second job pays $42,000 a year. So he makes $42,000 - $30,000 = $12,000 more. The answer is $12,000.

Q:

There are 220 castles in Scotland. 40% of them are ruins. Half of the ruined castles are unmanned. 220 * 0.4 = 88 ruined castles. 88 / 2 = 44 ruined castles that are unmanned. The answer is 44.

Q:

Robert wants to buy a bookshelf and a sofa. Furniture United's offer includes a $1,350 advance payment and 6 monthly installments of $350 each. Cozy Homes' offer includes a $1,100 advance payment and 9 monthly installments of $250 each. The cost difference is $1,350 - $1,100 = $250. The answer is $250.

Q:

Each person has 8, 10, 1 and 5 guns respectively. So if they shared equally, each person would get 8/4 = 2, 10/4 = 2.5, 1/4 = 0.25 and 5/4 = 1.25 guns. 2 + 2.5 + 0.25 + 1.25 = 6. The answer is 6.

Q:

Mason needs 30 ounces of sugar to make a batch of suckers. He needs 70 ounces of sugar to make a batch of fudge. 30 + 70 = 100 ounces of sugar. 8 batches of suckers and 1 batch of fudge will be 8 + 1 = 9 batches. 9 batches of suckers will be 9 * 30 = 270 ounces of sugar. 270 + 100 = 370 ounces of sugar. The answer is 370.

Q:

Maria bought 8 shares of a stock for $8 each. In the first year, the stock price increased by 50%. So the new price was 8 * 1.5 = 12 dollars. In the second year, the stock price decreased by 25%. So the new price was 12 / 1.25 = 9.6 dollars. The answer is 9.6.

Q:

Luke ate 2 hot dogs. Thomas ate 3 times more hot dogs than Luke. So Thomas ate 3 * 2 = 6 hot dogs. John ate half the amount Thomas ate. So John ate 6 / 2 = 3 hot dogs. John ate 3 more hot dogs than Luke. The answer is 3.

Q:

There are 200 students in the class. They are split into 3 groups. Each group has 200 / 3 = 67 students. The smallest group has 67 - 10 = 57 students. The answer is 57.

Q:

Farmer Brown has 60 animals on his farm. All of them are either chickens or cows. He has twice as many chickens as cows. So he has 60/2 = 30 chickens and 30 cows. 30 + 30 = 60. The answer is 60.

Q:

Josh started with 3 balls. Each week he added 1 ball. So after 4 weeks, he had 4 balls. But he dropped 3 balls. So he had 4 - 3 = 1 ball. The answer is 1.

Q:

Pink frog weighs 50 pounds. Blue beetle weighs 50 pounds. Green toad weighs 50 pounds. Yellow snake weighs 30 pounds. Red bird weighs 30 pounds. Total weight of container is 20 pounds. So the total weight of container is 50 + 50 + 50 + 30 + 30 + 20 = 200 pounds. The answer is 200.

Q:

Laurel started with 24 baby outfits. She received 2 * 24 = 48 new baby outfits. Then she received 15 more. 48 + 15 = 63. The answer is 63.

Q:

Tyson ran 5000 meters every day. But if he followed his coach's advice, he would run 1/5 times more meters in a day. 5000 / 5 = 1000. So he would run 1000 meters more per day. 1000 * 30 = 30000. So he ran 30000 meters in June. The answer is 30000.

Q:

Juice Box A is 4 dollars. Juice Box B is 5 dollars more than Juice Box A. Juice Box C is 7 dollars more than Juice Box A. So Juice Box C is 7 + 5 = 12 dollars more than Juice Box B. The answer is 12.

Q:

There are 40 tables with 4 legs. And there are 50 tables with 3 legs. So there are 40 + 50 = 90 legs. The answer is 90.

Q:

Jenny buys 1 bag of cookies a week. Each bag has 36 cookies. She puts 4 cookies in her son's lunch box 5 days a week. Her husband eats 1 cookie a day for 7 days. Jenny eats the rest of the cookies. 36 - 4 - 7 = 25. The answer is 25.

Q:

Davos bought 2 shirts from the mall that cost $30 each. If he bought them with a 40% discount, then 40% of 30 is 12. 12 + 30 is 42. The answer is 42.

Q:

They used to make tractors and sold 10 tractors a day. Each tractor cost $100. So they made $1000 a day. Now they make silos and sell 5 silos a day. Each silo costs $220. So they make $1100 a day. The difference is $1000 - $1100 = -$100. The answer is -100%.

Q:

Madeline spends $25 per week on food. She spends $20 per month on treats. She spends $100 per month on medicine. 4 weeks in a month is 48 weeks. 48 * 25 = 1200 dollars spent on food. 12 months in a year is 12 * 20 = 240 dollars spent on treats. 12 months in a year is 12 * 100 = 1200 dollars spent on medicine. 1200 + 240 + 1200 = 2760 dollars spent on her dog per year. The answer is 2760.

Q:

Peyton's activities are:
* Yoga class on Monday (1 hour)
* Cooking class on Tuesday (3 times longer than yoga class)
* Cheese-tasting event on Wednesday (half as long as cooking class)
* Museum tour on Thursday (half as long as cooking class)
* Errands on Friday (2 hours)
So the total time is:
* Yoga class on Monday (1 hour) + Cooking class on Tuesday (3 times longer than yoga class) + Cheese-tasting event on Wednesday (half as long as cooking class) + Museum tour on Thursday (half as long as cooking class) + Errands on Friday (2 hours)
= 1 + 3 + 1/2 + 1/2 + 2 = 6 hours.
The answer is 6 hours.

Q:

April had 100 plant pots. She was asked for 30 plant pots for the daisies, and twice as many for the roses. 30 + 2(x) = 100. Solving for x, we get x = 60. So she had 100 - 60 = 40 plant pots left over. The answer is 40.

Q:

Andrea started with 36 dollars. She spent 11 dollars on an $11 sweater. She also gave her brother 4 dollars. 36 - 11 - 4 is 21. The answer is 21.

Q:

John spent 6 hours boating and half that time swimming. That is 6/2 = 3 hours. He watched 3 different shows which were 2 hours each. That is 3 * 2 = 6 hours. He spent 40% of his time sightseeing. That is 40% of 24 hours = 9.6 hours. The answer is 9.6 hours.

Q:

Annabelle has $80 in her savings. She works 20 hours at her first job, which pays her $10 per hour. That is 20 x 10 = 200 dollars. She works 15 hours at her second job, which pays her $5 per hour. That is 15 x 5 = 75 dollars. So she needs to save 200 + 75 = 275 dollars. The answer is 275.

Q:

The shortest tree has a height of 6 feet. The second tree has a height of 5 feet more than the shortest tree. So it has a height of 6 + 5 = 11 feet. The tallest tree is twice the height of the two trees combined. 11 + 11 = 22 feet. The answer is 22.

Q:

Dean started with 28 dollars. He spent 6 * 2 + 5 * 1 = 13 dollars. Then his mother gave him an extra 10 dollars. 28 - 13 - 10 is 5. The answer is 5.

Q:

Morgan's dad said that she had $90 budgeted for her birthday party. She wants to make sure she and her friends all get to play one round of mini-golf, have $5 in arcade tokens, and get to ride the go-karts twice. A round of mini-golf is $5. The Go-karts cost $10 a ride. So if she wants to invite 5 friends, she needs 5 rounds of mini-golf, 5 arcade tokens, and 10 go-kart rides. 5 + 5 + 10 = 20. The answer is 20.

Q:

Marisa gets 5 dollars per day. 4 lollipops cost 25 cents each. So 4 * 25 = 100 cents. 5 * 100 = 500 cents. So she puts 500 cents in her piggy bank. The answer is 500.

Q:

Billy started with 10 dollars. Each pound of candy costs 1.5 dollars. So 10 / 1.5 = 6.6 pounds. After buying 40 gumballs, he took half his change and spent it on gumballs. 40 * .05 = 2 dollars. So he spent 2 dollars on gumballs. 10 - 2 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q:

Carver's son is 5 years less than twice the age of Carver. So Carver's son is 2 * (Carver's age - 5). Carver's age is 45. So his son is 2 * 45 - 5 = 90. The answer is 90.

Q:

The train travels 75 miles from the first city to the second city. Then it travels 100 miles from the second city to the third city. Finally, it travels 50 miles less than that combined distance to go from the third city to the first city. 75 + 100 + (50 - 100) = 225 miles. 225 / 3 = 75 miles per trip. 75 * 3 = 225 miles. 225 / 18000 = 12.5 days. The answer is 12.5.

Q:

Mark needs 8 pounds of stuffing for a Rottweiler bed. He needs 2 pounds of stuffing for a Chihuahua bed. And he needs an average amount of stuffing for a Collie bed. 8 + 2 + (8 + 2) / 2 = 12. The answer is 12.

Q:

John drove 200 miles to his friend's house. Then he took a detour that was 10 miles longer. Then he drove back home which was 240 miles. But he went 80 mph instead of 70 mph. 200 + 10 + 240 / 80 = 2 hours. The answer is 2 hours.

Q:

There are 96 fourth graders. 43 of them are girls. 5 fourth grade girls and 4 fourth grade boys were absent. So 96 - 43 - 5 - 4 = 42 boys. The answer is 42.

Q:

There are 6 girls in the park. Twice as many boys means 12 boys. So there are 6 + 12 = 18 kids in the park. The answer is 18.

Q:

Jane needs to get 42 points. She already got 15 + 18 = 33 points. So she needs to get 42 - 33 = 9 points on the third test. The answer is 9.

Q:

3 customers were kicked out for not wearing masks. 4 * (3 - 5) = 12 were kicked out for shoplifting. 3 * (12 - 3) = 24 were kicked out for physical violence. 50 - 24 - 12 = 14 were kicked out for other reasons. The answer is 14.

Q:

Erin scored 14 points. Sara scored 8 points. So Erin's score was 14 - 8 = 6. The answer is 6.

Q:

44 seniors need to receive awards.  Each senior receives a picture frame that costs $20.  Each picture frame needs to be etched with the logo for an additional 20% cost per frame.  2 of the seniors will also receive pins that are $5.  1/4 of the seniors are officers and they will need to receive cords that are $12 each.  So 44 * 20 + 44 * (20 / 100) + 2 * 5 + 12 * 4 = 1000 + 88 + 10 + 48 = 1229. The answer is 1229.

Q:

Hand-painted wallpaper costs $400 at the market. A DIY will saves 20% after considering the materials cost. So if Ethan made his own hand-painted wallpaper, it would cost him $400 * (1 - 0.2) = $320. The answer is $320.

Q:

The store sold 14 pairs of tennis shoes on friday. They sold double that number of shoes on saturday. On sunday, they sold half the number of shoes as they did on saturday. But 6 people returned their pairs because they didn't fit. So they sold 14 + 2 * 2 + 1/2 * 2 = 21 pairs of shoes. The answer is 21.

Q:

Hallie had dance practice for 1 hour on Tuesdays and 2 hours on Thursdays. On Saturdays, she had dance practice that lasted twice as long as Tuesday's night class. So it was 2 times 1 = 2 hours. So she had dance practice for 2 + 2 = 4 hours a week. The answer is 4.

Q:

They bought $400000 worth of equipment. But 40% of them were faulty. So they returned the faulty ones. That means they bought $400000 - (40% * $400000) = $240000 worth of functioning equipment. The answer is 240000.

Q:

Mary started with 30 sheep. Half of them produce 1 kg of milk per day. The other half produces 2 kg of milk per day. So 30 / 2 = 15 sheep produce 1 kg of milk per day. 15 * 1 = 15 kg of milk per day. The other 15 sheep produce 2 kg of milk per day. 15 * 2 = 30 kg of milk per day. So Mary collects 15 + 30 = 45 kg of milk per day. The answer is 45.

Q:

Mrs. Sherman made a dozen bread rolls for breakfast. After feeding her 6 children with one each, she broke each of the remaining rolls into 8 pieces and fed them to the chickens. So she had 12 - 6 = 6 rolls left. 6 rolls were broken into 8 pieces each. So 6 * 8 = 48 pieces of rolls were given to the chickens. The answer is 48.

Q:

There are 40 pupils in the class. Half of them like blue. One fourth of the remaining pupils like green. The rest like yellow. So half of 40 is 20. One fourth of 20 is 5. The rest is 15. 20 + 5 + 15 is 40. The answer is 40.

Q:

Lucy started with 0 apples. On Monday, she picked all the apples. So she had 0 + 12 = 12 apples. On Tuesday, she picked double the number of apples she did the previous day. So she picked 12 + 24 = 36 apples. On Wednesday, she picked double the number of apples she did the previous day. So she picked 36 + 72 = 108 apples. 108 apples times 4 dollars per apple is 432 dollars. 432 dollars minus 56 dollars is 376 dollars. The answer is 376.

Q:

Lindsay started with 50 socks. She washed 10 pairs of socks and 15 loose socks. So she had 50 - (10 * 2) - 15 = 24 socks left. The answer is 24.

Q:

Rachel started with 23 cookies. Janet gave her 42 cookies. Her brother ate 44 of those cookies. So Rachel had 23 + 42 - 44 = 19 cookies. The answer is 19.

Q:

Karan borrowed 3650 dollars for 5 months. At an interest rate of 10%, she has to pay an equal amount every month. 3650 * 10% / 12 = 304 dollars. The answer is 304.

Q:

Cho hiked 14 kilometers per hour for 8 hours. That is 14 * 8 = 112 kilometers. Chloe hiked 9 kilometers per hour and stopped after 5 hours. That is 9 * 5 = 45 kilometers. So Cho hiked 112 - 45 = 67 kilometers farther than Chloe. The answer is 67.

Q:

Axel had 50 silver pesos and 80 gold pesos. Anna had 2x(50) + 40 = 100 silver pesos and 80 gold pesos. So their total was 50 + 80 + 100 + 80 = 310. The answer is 310.

Q:

Millie spent 18 dollars to buy enough supplies to make 3 pitchers of lemonade. Each pitcher holds 12 cups of lemonade. She sold each cup of lemonade for 1 dollar. She sold an average of 4 cups per hour that her lemonade stand was open. If she sold all of the lemonade, then she made 18 dollars. 18 / 4 = 4.5 dollars per hour. The answer is 4.5 dollars per hour.

Q:

Mr. Ruther had 3/5 of his land. That means he had 5/5 - 3/5 = 2/5 of his land. 2/5 of his land is 2/5 * 12.8 = 4.7 hectares. So he had 12.8 - 4.7 = 8.1 hectares left. 8.1 is 8.1/100ths of a hectare. The answer is 8.1/100ths of a hectare.

Q:

Lisa was part of a choir that had 52 members. 50% of those were boys and 50% were girls.  The choir decided to perform with just its female members.  However, half the people performing couldn't make it to the show because their bus broke down.  The choir's 3 teachers then decided to sing with them.  So the number of people singing was 52 - (50% * 50%) = 26. 26 + 3 = 29. The answer is 29.

Q:

Wilson's math grade is calculated by the average of 5 test scores. 65 + 94 + 81 + 86 + 74 / 5 = 80.5. The answer is 80.5.

Q:

6 erasers and 8 pencils cost 6 * 2 + 8 * 3 = 24 + 24 = 48 dollars. The answer is 48.

Q:

James delivered 66 messages to Ms. Thompson. He also delivered 1/3 as many messages to Mr. Yu. 66 + (1/3) = 84. The answer is 84.

Q:

David and Dasha went to the carnival. They rode 9 rides. Each ride cost 2 ride tickets at $2 per ticket. David bought a ride bracelet for $30 which gives him 9 rides. Dasha bought tickets. David saved $30 - 9 * 2 = $18. The answer is $18.

Q:

Monica has 6 gifts to wrap for her family, 4 gifts to wrap for her friends and 2 gifts to wrap for her teachers. So she has 6 + 4 + 2 = 12 gifts to wrap. She has 144 inches of ribbon. 12 gifts * 144 inches of ribbon per gift = 1728 inches of ribbon. So she can use 1728 / 12 = 144 inches of ribbon for each gift bow. The answer is 144.

Q:

Betty and Sam have 5:6 popsicles. So Betty has 5/6 of the popsicles. Sam has 6/6 of the popsicles. 5/6 + 6/6 = 11/6. Sam has 11/6 more popsicles than Betty. The answer is 11/6.

Q:

Tim starts with $60. He gets Netflix for $10 a month. Hulu and Disney Plus normally cost $10 a month each. But he saves 20% for bundling. So he pays $10 + (10 * 0.2) = $12 for Hulu and Disney Plus. So he saves $60 - $12 = $48. The answer is 48.

Q:

Carol spent 4 hours writing a song. Half that much time was spent recording it. 4 / 2 = 2. Then she spent 90 minutes editing it. 2 + 90 = 92. 92 / 90 = 98%. The answer is 98%.

Q:

Wendy wants to place 20 more than double the number of books in a shelving system with 6 rows and 6 columns. 20 more than double means 20 + 2 * 2 = 24. 24 more than 6 is 24 - 6 = 18. So she needs 18 more books. The answer is 18.

Q:

Erica started with 20 cards. She had 2 boxes of pre-made cards that had 15 cards each. So she had 2 boxes * 15 = 30 cards. She passed out 24 to her classmates, 5 to her family and received 17 from family and friends. So she had 30 - 24 - 5 + 17 = 13 cards. The answer is 13.

Q:

Jenny started with 12 slices. She gave 1/3 to Bill and 1/4 to Mark. That is 12 - (1/3) - (1/4) = 12 - 1/12 - 1/12 = 12 - 1/12 = 11 slices. Then she ate 2 slices. So 11 - 2 = 9 slices are left. The answer is 9.

Q:

Mark has 50 dollars in his bank account. He earns 10 dollars per day at his work. 300 divided by 10 is 30. 30 days. The answer is 30.

Q:

Nancy counted 90 spiders, 1/3rd as many millipedes as spiders, and a number of stink bugs equal to twice the number of millipedes minus 12. So 90 + (1/3) * 90 + 2 * (90 - 12) = 210. The answer is 210.

Q:

Alice is 7 years older than Beth. Beth is 5 years older than Erica. So Alice is 7 + 5 = 12 years older than Erica. Erica is 30 years old. 30 - 12 = 18 years old. The answer is 18.

Q:

A glass of milk is 8 ounces of milk.  John drinks 2 glasses of milk.  Each glass of milk has 3 calories per ounce.  So 2 * 3 = 6 calories per glass. 6 * 2 = 12 calories per glass. 12 * 2 = 24 calories per glass. 24 * 2 = 48 calories per glass. 48 * 2 = 96 calories per glass. 96 * 2 = 192 calories per glass. 192 * 2 = 384 calories per glass. 384 * 2 = 768 calories per glass. 768 * 2 = 1536 calories per glass. 1536 * 2 = 3072 calories per glass. 3072 * 2 = 6144 calories per glass. 6144 * 2 = 12288 calories per glass. 12288 * 2 = 24576 calories

The builder works for 4 weeks every month and for 6 days every week. So he works for 4 * 6 = 24 weeks per year. 24 weeks * 50 dollars per day is 1200 dollars per year. The answer is 1200.

Q:

Mark needs 3 cups of flour and 1 cup of milk. Flour is sold in 2-cup bags. Milk is sold in 2-cup bottles. So he needs 3 / 2 = 1.5 bags of flour and 1 / 2 = 0.5 bottles of milk. 1.5 bags of flour is 3 times more than 0.5 bottles of milk. The answer is 3.

Q:

Mel used an air conditioner for 8 hours a day. Each hour it used 900 watts of energy. If he reduced the time he used the air conditioner by 5 hours a day, then each hour it would use 900 / 5 = 180 watts of energy. 180 watts * 30 days = 5400 watts. The answer is 5400.

Q:

Jane counted 2 zebras with 17 stripes each, a zebra with 36 stripes, and another zebra with half that many stripes. So the average number of stripes is (17 + 36) / 2 = 25. The answer is 25.

Q:

Tyson needed 1 pound of meat and 1 pound of cheese for each sandwich. 20 people watched the game. 1 pound of meat costs $7.00. 1 pound of cheese costs $3.00. 20 * (1 * 7) + 20 * (1 * 3) = 140 + 60 = 200 dollars. The answer is 200 dollars.

Q:

At Allan's house, there is twice as much corn as cannolis. So there are 2x as many corn as cannolis. Let's say there are 2x corn and 2x cannolis. Allan bought 60 more cannolis at the store and 40 fewer corns than the number of cannolis. So let's subtract 40 from 2x. 2x - 40 = 1x. So there are 1x corn and 1x cannolis. 1x + 60 = 40. So there are 40 cannolis and 40 corn. 40 + 40 = 80. The answer is 80.

Q:

Elliott took 10,000 steps. He finished half of them on his walks to and from school. That leaves him with 5,000 steps. He did another 1,000 steps going for a short walk with his friend. That leaves him with 4,000 steps. He also went for a short jog around the block and realized that after he had finished his jog, he only had 2,000 steps left to take. 4,000 + 2,000 = 6,000. The answer is 6,000.

Q:

Toby's book is 45 pages long. Each page has 200 words. So it has 45 * 200 = 9000 words. Toby reads 300 words per minute. So he will take 9000 / 300 = 30 minutes to read the whole book. 30 minutes + 10 minutes to get to the airport is 40 minutes. So he will be 40 minutes early. The answer is 40 minutes.

Q:

In May, they hired 40 employees. Each employee was paid $15 per hour for a 40-hour workweek. So they paid 40 * 15 * 40 = 6000 dollars. In June, 1/4 of the employees' contracts expired. So they paid 40 * 15 * 40 / 4 = 6000 / 4 = 1500 dollars. The answer is 1500.

Q:

Sally started with 10 dollars. She bought 2 pounds of taffy for 3 dollars each. That is 2 x 3 = 6 dollars. She also bought a mixed bag of seashells for 1.50 dollars. And she bought 4 magnets for 0.25 dollars each. 6 + 1.50 + 4 x 0.25 = 10.50. So she has 10.50 dollars left. The answer is 10.50.

Q:

Tim spent $400 on one pack of fireworks. He spent $800 on another pack of fireworks. He spent $150 on a finale firework. 400 + 800 + 150 = 1350. The answer is 1350.

Q:

Shannon makes 1 dozen cookies per batch. She needs to make 30 days worth of cookies. 30 / 1 = 30. The answer is 30.

Q:

Misha picked out 4 blouses from the 30% off rack. Each blouse was originally $20. So 4 * 20 = 80. 80 * 0.3 = 24. The answer is 24.

Q:

Joanne gathered 30 apples from the tallest trees, half this amount from the shortest trees, and more apples from the average trees. Compared with Joanne, her sister gathers twice as many apples from the tallest trees and 3 times as many apples from the shortest trees. She doesn't take any from the average trees. So Joanne took 30 + (half of 30) + (more than 30) = 60 apples from the average trees. 500 - 60 = 440 apples. The answer is 440.

Q:

There are 180 heads and 304 bumps. Camels have two humps each. Dromedaries have one hump each. So there are 180/2 = 90 camels. 304/1 = 304 dromedaries. The answer is 304.

Q:

Tom made 200 km per day for 4 days. That is 200 * 4 = 800 km. Then he made 30% of 800 km, which is 240 km. Then he didn't travel for one day. Then he made 300 km per day for 7 days. That is 300 * 7 = 2100 km. The answer is 2100.

Q:

Zack's locker is half as big as Timothy's locker. So it is 1/2 * 5 = 2.5 cubic inches. Peter's locker is 1/4 as big as Zack's locker. So it is 1/4 * 2.5 = 0.625 cubic inches. Timothy's locker is 5 cubic inches. So 5 / 0.625 = 8 cubic inches. The answer is 8.

Q:

Stanley was standing at an elevation of 10,000 feet. His comb fell 4,000 feet. So the elevation of the comb is 10,000 - 4,000 = 6,000 feet. Oliver was at an elevation of 3,000 feet. So he needs to climb 6,000 - 3,000 = 3,000 feet. The answer is 3,000.

Q:

Mr. Josue had 5000 dollars. The first bank gave him 4000 dollars. The second bank gave him twice as much. 4000 + 2(4000) = 8000. So he has 5000 + 8000 = 13000 dollars. The answer is 13000.

Q:

There were 50 cats on the rock. 4 boats came and took 5 cats each. Later, 3/5 of the remaining cats ran after a mouse they'd seen. 50 - 20 = 30 cats were left on the rock. 30 / 5 = 6 cats. The answer is 6.

Q:

Bill started with 8 dollars per month. After 6 months, it was 8 * 6 = 48 dollars. After 8 months, it was 48 * 8 = 384 dollars. After 2 years, it was 384 * 2 = 768 dollars. The answer is 768.

Q:

Cole bought tattered jeans for $28. He also bought jogger jeans for $22. So he saved $6. If he saved 1/3 of the total savings from the jogger jeans and the rest from the tattered jeans, then 1/3 of 6 is 2. So he saved 2 dollars from the jogger jeans. The original price of the jogger jeans was $22 - 2 = $20. The answer is $20.

Q:

Lillian started with no bird feeders. She built 3 and bought 3 others. Each bird feeder seemed to attract 20 birds throughout the day. So 3 * 20 = 60 birds. But the store-bought ones only attracted 10 more birds each. 60 - 10 * 3 = 40 birds. The answer is 40.

Q:

Aleksandra ordered some soup, a bagel, and a piece of cake. The bagel cost 4 dollars. The soup was 25% more than the bagel. The cake was half the price of the bagel. So the soup cost 1.25 times the bagel. The cake cost 0.5 times the bagel. So the total cost of the meal was 1.25 * 0.5 = 0.625 times the bagel. 4 + 0.625 = 4.625. The answer is 4.625.

Q:

Kenny started with 100 cards. He sold 1/3 of them for $1.5 each. That is 1/3 * 100 = 33.33. He kept 1/3 of those, so he kept 33.33 / 3 = 11.11. He spent 11.11 * 100 = 1111 dollars. He was left with 1111 - 50 = 1061 dollars. The answer is 1061.

Q:

The caterer was told to prepare gourmet hot dogs for 36 guests. But 40 guests showed up. Everyone wanted a second hot dog. So 40 - 36 = 4 guests didn't get a second hot dog. The answer is 4.

Q:

Indras has 6 letters in her name. Her sister's name has 4 more letters than half of the letters in Indras' name. So Indras' name has 6 + 4 = 10 letters. Her sister's name has 10 + 2 = 12 letters. The answer is 12.

Q:

Charlotte knew she wanted a set of pot and pans for $120.00, a set of mixing bowls for $20.00 and 5 separate utensils at $5.00 each.  At check out, the clerk told her everything was 20% off.  So 120 + 20 + 5 * 5 = 155. The answer is 155.

Q:

Dora has $2 from her allowance. Her mother gave her $16. So she has $18. Skipping rope costs $6. Board game costs $11. Playground ball costs $2. So she needs $6 + 11 + 2 = 19 dollars more. The answer is 19.

Q:

Prince Thaddeus slew 100 dragons. Prince Arthur slew 75 dragons. Prince Walter slew 150 dragons. Prince Bruce slew 20 dragons. 100 + 75 + 150 + 20 = 345. The answer is 345.

Q:

15 gallons were divided into 5 containers. Each container had 1/5 of a gallon. Josey needed 1/4 of a container. 1/4 of 1/5 is 1/20. 1/20 of 15 is 75. The answer is 75.

Q:

George started with 5 dollars. He bought 3 bags of chips for 40 cents each. That is 3 x 40 = 120 cents. He also bought 1 candy bar for 75 cents. 120 + 75 = 195 cents. So he had 5 - 195 = 190 cents left. 190 / 100 = 1.9. The answer is 1.9.

Q:

Ray had 25 lollipops. He kept 5 lollipops for himself. So he had 25 - 5 = 20 lollipops. He shared the remaining equally with his four friends. 20 / 4 = 5. Each friend received 5 lollipops. The answer is 5.

Q:

Rory made a cake that weighed 20 ounces. She cut it into 8 pieces. So 20 / 8 = 2.5 ounces per piece. Rory and her mom each have a piece. So 2.5 * 2 = 5 ounces. The answer is 5.

Q:

Sitti bought 34 oranges. Juris bought 22 oranges. They decided to share them equally with their 6 other friends. 34 / 6 = 5.5. 22 / 6 = 3.67. So each person gets 5.5 + 3.67 = 9.17 oranges. The answer is 9.17.

Q:

Antoine's french onion soup recipe calls for 2 pounds of onions. He likes to double that amount. His soup serves 6 people. The onions are currently on sale for $2.00 a pound. He also needs 2 boxes of beef stock, that are also on sale for $2.00 a box.  The cost per serving is 2 pounds of onions * 2 dollars per pound + 2 boxes of beef stock * 2 dollars per box = 4 dollars per serving. The answer is 4.

Q:

Wayne is staying at a hotel close to the premiere theater. Bernadette is staying at her high-rise apartment in the same city. The drive from Bernadette’s apartment takes four times as long as the drive from Wayne’s hotel. So if it takes Wayne four minutes to be driven to the theater, then it will take Bernadette 4 * 4 = 16 minutes to be driven to the theater. So Bernadette needs to leave 16 minutes earlier than Wayne. The answer is 16.

Q:

The area of Billie's bedroom is 360 square feet. The length of the room is 3 yards. The perimeter of the room is 3 * 4 = 12 feet. The answer is 12.

Q:

Elizabeth bought 1 pack of red and 2 packs of clear beads. That is 1 + 2 = 3 packs of beads. Margareth bought 3 packs of blue and 4 packs of red beads. That is 3 + 4 = 7 packs of beads. So Elizabeth has 3 more beads than Margareth. The answer is 3.

Q:

Marcus' house was 40 degrees when he woke up. It raised 5 degrees every hour while the oven was on. So it was 40 + 5 * 3 = 55 degrees after 3 hours. Then he opened a window for 30 minutes. Every 10 minutes the window was open, the house cooled down 2 degrees. So it was 55 - 2 * 30 = 47 degrees after 30 minutes. Finally, it was 47 + 5 * 10 = 52 degrees after 10 minutes. The answer is 52.

Q:

Jon ran a triathlon. It took him 40 minutes for the swim, an hour and 20 minutes for the bike ride and 50 minutes for the run. Compared to Jon, James finished the swim 10% faster but took 5 minutes longer on the bike. If Jon won by 10 minutes, then James took 50 minutes for the run. The answer is 50 minutes.

Q:

Movie A was one-fourth the length of Movie B. Movie B was 5 minutes longer than Movie C. Movie C was 1.25 hours. So Movie A was (1/4) * (Movie B) + (Movie B - Movie C). 1/4 * 5 + 5 = 1.25. The answer is 1.25.

Q:

Michael's horse ran for 30 minutes at 32 MPH. Each mile it ran, it ate 1/2 a bail of hay. 30 / 32 = 0.94 miles per minute. 0.94 * 1/2 = 0.47 bails of hay per minute. 30 * 0.47 = 14.1 bails of hay. 14.1 * 3 = 42.3 dollars. 42.3 - 6 * 5 = 21.3 dollars. The answer is 21.3.

Q:

Rozanne used 4 dozen eggs that were in cases and another 2 eggs that were loose in the cupboard. 4 dozen eggs is 48 eggs. 2 eggs is 2 eggs. 48 + 2 = 50 eggs. Each glass needs 5 eggs. 50 / 5 = 10 trays. The answer is 10.

Q:

Q:
