The total number of people that entered the restaurant on that day is 50 + 40 + 2(40) + 3(50) = 160. The answer is 160.

Q:

Alain's mom bought 5 packs of red pens. Each pack has 5 pens. She also bought twice as many black pens as red pens. So if each pack has 5 pens, then each pack has 5 * 2 = 10 pens. So Alain has 5 * 10 = 50 pens. The answer is 50.

Q:

John spent 600 dollars on 10 bottles of scotch. He also spent 2 times as much on 10 bottles of cognac. 2 * 1.5 = 3. So he spent 600 + 3 = 603 dollars. The answer is 603.

Q:

Mr. Julius planted 20 White Oak trees on the first day. He planted 2 times as many Lodgepole Pine trees as White Oak trees. So he planted 20 * 2 = 40 Lodgepole Pine trees. On the second day, he planted 10 more White Oak trees and 1/4 more Lodgepole Pine trees than he planted on the first day. 10 + 1/4 = 10.5. So he planted 40 + 10.5 = 50.5 Lodgepole Pine trees. The answer is 50.5.

Q:

Fred had 24 gallons of root beer. His children drank 4 gallons. His wife spilled 7 gallons. Ronnie drank 5 gallons. So there were only 18 gallons left. 3 people came to the party. Each person can get 18 / 3 = 6 gallons. The answer is 6.

Q:

Eight more than four times the number of coffee mugs in the teacher's lounge is 40. 4 * 8 = 32. So the original number was 32 + 8 = 40. The answer is 40.

Q:

There are 66 fish in the fish tank. 1/3 of them have red stripes. 5/11 of the rest have blue stripes. 66 * (1/3) = 22. 22 * 5/11 = 11. So there are 22 + 11 = 33 fish with red stripes and blue stripes. The answer is 33.

Q:

Amy had two eyeshadow palettes with four colors each. Each makeup set came with six eyeshadow colors each. So she had 2 * 4 + 3 * 6 = 24 eyeshadow colors. Half of 6 is 3. So she used up 3 colors from one makeup set. 24 - 3 = 21. The answer is 21.

Q:

Mattison is 60 inches tall. His two-story house is 7 times as high as he is. The floor to the ceiling on the first floor is thrice as high as he is. So the height of the second floor is 7 * 3 = 21 inches. The answer is 21.

Q:

Team Alphas found 40% of the shells. That means they found 40% of 700 = 280 shells. Team The Finders found 60% of the remaining shells. That means they found 60% of 700 - 280 = 420 shells. Team Gogetters found 420 shells. The answer is 420.

Q:

Bernie has 4 dogs. Each one needs to walk 1 mile, 4 miles, 3 miles, and 3 miles on average. So the last dog needs to walk 3 miles. The answer is 3.

Q:

John's house was worth $250,000. He got a loan worth 40% of that. That is 40% of $250,000 = $100,000. He used 60% of that to pay off his debts. That is 60% of $100,000 = $60,000. So he had $60,000 left over. The answer is $60,000.

Q:

Deandre caught 3 tunas. The first one weighed 56 kg. The second one weighed 46 kg. The third one weighed 26 kg. 56 + 46 + 26 = 128 kg. 128 kg * 0.50 = 64 dollars. The answer is 64 dollars.

Q:

Trinity sold magazines at 11/8 of the price she bought them. So if she bought them at $72, then she sold them at $72 / 11/8 = $84. So her profit is $84 - $72 = $12. The answer is $12.

Q:

Brian started with 1 liter of water per day. That is 1 * 3 = 3 liters per day. Then he used the medium setting for 2 more days. That is 2 * 3 = 6 liters per day. Finally, he used the high setting for 5 more days. That is 5 * 3 = 15 liters per day. So the total is 3 + 6 + 15 = 24 liters. The answer is 24.

Q:

Jolene filled up 10 packs of balloons that have 30 balloons per pack. 12 balloons were left. 10 * 30 = 300 balloons were thrown. The answer is 300.

Q:

One medical dosage requires 14 mL of one medicine and 3 times that amount of the second medicine. 14 + 3 * 14 = 42 mL. 8 dosages require 42 / 8 = 5 mL. The answer is 5.

Q:

Ali's class has 120 students. John's class has 1/8 the capacity of Ali's class. So it has 1/8 * 120 = 15 students. John's second class has 1/8 the capacity of Ali's class. So it has 1/8 * 120 = 15 students. So the combined capacity is 120 + 15 + 15 = 150. The answer is 150.

Q:

Stephen borrowed $300. He will pay $25 per month for 11 months. In the twelfth month, he will pay the remaining amount plus the interest. The remaining amount is $300 - $25 * 11 = $275. The interest is $275 * 2% = $5.50. So the total payment is $275 + $5.50 = $280.50. The answer is $280.50.

Q:

Jordan has 2 children. Each child needs 5 diaper changes per day. His wife changes half of them. So he changes 2 * 5 = 10 diapers per day. The answer is 10.

Q:

Tim starts with an estimate of 30%. That means 30% of 900 is 270. 270 / 15 = 18.33. 18.33 is not close enough. The answer is 18.33.

Q:

The bus started with 20 people. At the first stop, 40 people entered the bus. At the second stop, 3/4 of the total number of people who entered the bus at the first stop entered the bus. At the third stop, the number of passengers doubled. So at the third stop, 2 * 3/4 = 1.5 times as many people entered the bus. 20 + 40 + 1.5 * 3/4 = 100.5. The answer is 100.5.

Q:

Pauline visited the museum 3 times a year. Each time it costs $2. After 5 years, the cost of one visit was 150% higher than before. So it costs $2 * 1.5 = 3 dollars. After 3 more years, it costs $3 * 1.5 = 4.5 dollars. So Pauline spent 3 * 2 + 3 * 1.5 + 3 * 1.5 = 12 + 4.5 + 4.5 = 21.5 dollars. The answer is 21.5.

Q:

There are 10 students in each grade. Each student can earn 1 point per book read. So if all 10 students read 10 books each, then they would earn 100 points. 100 / 10 = 10. So each student needs to read 10 books to earn 100 points. 100 points is enough to qualify for the escape room. 100 points / 10 = 10. So each student needs to read 10 books to qualify for the escape room. 10 books is 10 * 10 minutes = 100 minutes. So it takes 100 minutes for each student to read 10 books. 100 minutes is 1 hour and 40 minutes. So it takes 1 hour and 40 minutes for each student to read 10 books. 1 hour and 40 minutes is 1 hour and 40 minutes. So it takes 1 hour and 40 minutes for each student to read 10 books.

### Questions 1-10

Q:

John made 4 tables for $20 each and 2 roof frames for $10 each. So 4 x 20 + 2 x 10 = 80 + 20 = 100 dollars. So Ali has to pay John 100 dollars. The answer is 100.

Q:

Ian's board was 40 feet long. He decided to make a cut so he could have two pieces. The longer piece is 4 times longer than the shorter piece. 40 / 4 = 10. The answer is 10.

Q:

Aiden needs 80 meatballs. Each pound of meat makes 16 meatballs. So 80 / 16 = 5 pounds of meat. 5 pounds of meat requires 2 tablespoons of seasoning per pound. 2 tablespoons of seasoning per pound is 2 tablespoons per 5 pounds. 2 tablespoons per 5 pounds is 0.4 tablespoons per pound. 0.4 tablespoons per pound is 0.4 tablespoons per 16 meatballs. 0.4 tablespoons per 16 meatballs is 0.025 tablespoons per meatball. 0.025 tablespoons per meatball is 0.025 tablespoons of seasoning per meatball. The answer is 0.025 tablespoons of seasoning per meatball.

Q:

Luke needs to buy fabric equal to 2 times the total width of the windows. 2 * 5 = 10. The answer is 10.

Q:

To make a call from a payphone, you must pay $0.25 for each minute of your call. After 16 minutes, that price drops to $0.2 per minute. 36 minutes is 16 * 2 = 32 minutes. 32 minutes is 32 / 60 = 0.5333... minutes. 0.5333... * 0.25 = 0.13666... dollars. 0.13666... rounded up is 0.14 dollars. The answer is 0.14 dollars.

Q:

It rained 2 inches on Monday. It is expected to rain 1 more inch than twice of Monday's total on Tuesday. 2 + (1/2) * 2 = 3. The answer is 3.

Q:

Carly made 2 less than 3 times as many brownies as cupcakes. Let's say she made 3x as many brownies as cupcakes. That means she made 3 * 3 = 9 brownies. She made 2 less than 9. 9 - 2 = 7. So she made 7 brownies. She made 7 cupcakes. The answer is 7.

Q:

Basic manicure starts at $35. Pedicure starts at $40. 20% off means 20/100 = 0.2. 0.2 * 35 = 7. So basic manicure is $35 - 7 = 28. Pedicure is $40 - 7 = 33. Nail art is $3 * 10 = 30. Total is 28 + 33 + 30 = 91. The answer is 91.

Q:

Susan ordered 3 magazines. Each magazine sent 12 issues a year. One magazine sent 6 issues a year. The other one sent 4 times as many issues as the 6 issue magazine. 12 * 3 = 36 issues per year. 6 * 4 = 24 issues per year. 36 - 24 = 12 issues per year. The answer is 12.

Q:

Samantha has 12 fewer paintings than Shelley. Shelley has 8 more paintings than Kim. So if Samantha has 27 paintings, then Shelley has 27 + 8 = 35 paintings. Kim has 35 - 12 = 23 paintings. The answer is 23.

Q:

In November, the toy was $40. In December, the price increased by 80%. In January, the price decreased by 50%. So in January, the price was (40 * 1.8) / 2 = 24. The answer is 24.

Q:

Charlie's standard fee is $80 per hour. When he gives lessons to a veteran, he reduces it by 25%. So if he gives 2 lessons to a veteran, he will get 25% off. 4 * 80 + 2 * (80 * 0.75) = 360 + 180 = 540. The answer is 540.

Q:

Sally's scores are 50, 80, 80, 60, 40, 90, 100, 70, 60. The sum of these numbers is 600. The average is 600 / 10 = 60. The answer is 60.

Q:

Eve had 20 pieces of pomelos. After giving her friend some pomelos, she was left with 20 / 4 = 5 pieces of pomelos. 20 - 5 is 15. The answer is 15.

Q:

Walter bought 60 apples. He ate 2/5 of them. That means he ate 2/5 * 60 = 12 apples. He gave his sister 25% of the remaining number. That means he gave her 25% of 60 = 15 apples. He sold the remaining apples to his uncle at $3 each. That means he sold 60 - 12 - 15 = 33 apples. 33 apples at $3 each is $102. The answer is $102.

Q:

Regina wrote 9 novels last year. This is 3/4 of the number of novels she has written this year. 9 / 4 = 2.25. So she has written 2.25 novels this year. The answer is 2.25.

Q:

Michael's average speed is 50km/hr. In 3 days, he will go 50km/hr * 3 days = 150km. 6000 / 150 is 40%. The answer is 40%.

Q:

Madeline ate 6 grapes. Her brother made grape juice using 5 times as many grapes as Madeline. So he used 5 * 6 = 30 grapes. Their mother used the remaining grapes to make 4 pies. So 30 + 4 = 34 grapes. 34 grapes is 12 grapes per pie. The answer is 12.

Q:

Last Friday, 13 of the 82 teachers were sick. 9 substitutes were called in. So 82 - 13 + 9 = 78 teachers were at school that day. The answer is 78.

Q:

Bud spent $1 per box of pasta. He spent $3 on cheddar cheese and $6 on gruyere cheese. 1 * 52 = 52 boxes of pasta. 52 * 3 = 156 dollars on cheddar cheese. 156 * 2 = 312 dollars on gruyere cheese. 52 + 156 + 312 = 510 dollars. The answer is 510 dollars.

Q:

The custodian has to clean 80 classrooms. Each classroom takes 15 minutes. So 80 * 15 = 1200 minutes. 1200 / 8 = 150 minutes. 150 / 15 = 10 hours. The answer is 10%.

Q:

Elly has 110 books. The middle shelf can hold 10 books. The bottom shelf can hold 20 books. The top shelf can hold 10 books less than the bottom shelf. 110 / 10 = 11. 11 * 2 = 22. The answer is 22.

Q:

Rose bought 5 dozens of eggs for $2.40 a dozen. Selling them for $1 for 3 eggs will be 5 * 3 = 15 dollars. So she made 2.40 * 15 = 36 dollars. The answer is 36.

Q:

Skyler has 100 hats. 1/2 of them are red. 3/5 of the remaining hats are blue. The rest are white. 100 / 2 = 50. 50 * 3/5 = 30. 30 + 50 = 80. 80 - 100 = -20. The answer is -20.

Q:

Archie buys beef jerky that comes 30 sticks to a bag and costs $18.00 per bag.  If Archie buys 1 bag while they're $3.00 off a bag, then 1 bag is 30 sticks. 1 bag is $18.00. 1 bag is $18.00 / 30 sticks = $0.60 per stick. The answer is $0.60.

Q:

Audrey needs to get 70% of 70 questions correct. That is 70 * 0.7 = 49. She got 60% of 70 questions correct. That is 60 * 0.6 = 36. So she needs to get 49 - 36 = 13 questions correct on the second test. The answer is 13.

Q:

Mary made 116 ice cubes total. 5 times the number of strawberry cubes minus 4 is 5 * (number of strawberry cubes) - 4. 116 - 4 is 112. So she made 112 blueberry cubes. The answer is 112.

Q:

Ara joined the school basketball team four years ago. She played 40 games every year. In each game, she scored 21 points. So 40 * 21 = 840 points. The answer is 840.

Q:

Brendan started with 10 marbles. He dropped half of them. Then he found 3. Then he found one was not a marble. So he ended up with 3 - 1 = 2 marbles. The answer is 2.

Q:

Jason needs to sell 15 cars. To get 15 people to come into the car dealership, he needs to make 15 / (25/2) = 15 / 12.5 = 1.25 times 25 telephone calls. 1.25 times 25 is 31.25. So he needs to make 31.25 telephone calls.

Q:

There are 8 rooms in the house. Each room has 2 flashlights. Each person has 1 flashlight. So there are 8 * 2 + 4 * 1 = 16 flashlights. There are 4 small candles per room. So there are 4 * 4 = 16 small candles. There are 5 medium candles per room. So there are 5 * 4 = 20 medium candles. The answer is 16 + 16 + 20 = 52.

Q:

Mitchell bought 2 bags of chips with 55 chips each. Each member of his family gets 55 / 5 = 11 chips. The answer is 11.

Q:

First side takes 5 minutes. Second and third sides each take 10 minutes. Fourth and fifth sides each take 5 minutes. Sixth side takes 1 minute. Total time is 5 + 10 + 5 + 5 + 1 = 21 minutes. The answer is 21 minutes.

Q:

Dominick saw 20 helmets. Half as many robots as helmets means 20 / 2 = 10 robots. Half as many helmets as footballs means 20 / 4 = 5 footballs. So he saw 10 + 5 = 15 robots and 5 footballs. The answer is 15.

Q:

Tim works 6 hours per day. Each call takes 15 minutes. 6 * 15 = 90 minutes. 90 / 6 = 15 calls per day. 15 * 5 = 75 calls per week. The answer is 75.

Q:

Louise usually applies a coat of varnish to her paintings in 7 minutes. Today she uses a new varnish which takes 12 minutes. So if she applied 6 coats of varnish, it would take 6 * 12 = 72 minutes. 72 - 7 = 65 minutes. The answer is 65 minutes.

Q:

Phineas started at 200 yards away from his home. He can travel 20 yards per minute on land and 10 yards per minute in water. So he can travel 20 + 10 = 30 yards per minute. 200 / 30 = 6.666... minutes. The answer is 6.666...

Q:

Bob needs 56 popsicle sticks. Each box contains 8 popsicle sticks. So 56 / 8 = 7 boxes. 7 boxes costs 7 * 2 = 14 dollars. The answer is 14 dollars.

Q:

There are 5 phones on a phone plan. The main phone costs twice as much as each additional phone. So if the main phone plan costs $20, then the other four phones must cost $10 each. 5 * 10 = 50. The answer is 50.

Q:

Derrick makes 10 dozen doughnuts every day. Each doughnut costs $2. So he makes 10 * 2 = 20 dollars per day. In June, he made 30 days worth of doughnuts. 30 * 20 = 600 dollars. The answer is 600.

Q:

Jade took 210 photos. She uploaded 7 photos in one batch. So she uploaded 210 / 7 = 30 batches. 30 batches in 6 days is 30 / 6 = 5 days. The answer is 5.

Q:

Alicia's clothes have to be sent to the dry cleaners weekly. Her weekly drop-off includes 5 blouses, 2 pants and 1 skirt. If they charge her $5.00 per blouse, $6.00 per skirt and $8.00 per pair of pants, then it costs $5 * 5 + $6 * 2 + $8 * 1 = 30 + 12 + 8 = 50 dollars. The answer is 50 dollars.

Q:

John's normal speaking speed is 150 WPM. After training, his speed is 2.5 times faster than his original speed. 150 * 2.5 = 375 WPM. 10 pages have 450 words per page. 450 / 375 = 1.2 pages per minute. 1.2 minutes per page. 10 pages * 1.2 minutes per page = 12 minutes. The answer is 12 minutes.

Q:

Conor started with 50 people. On the second day, 20 more people were present. So 50 + 20 = 70 people. On the third day, the total number of people increased to twice the number that were there on the second day. So 70 * 2 = 140 people. If Conor saw an average of 60 people each day the rest of the week, then 60 * 5 = 300 people. The answer is 300.

Q:

In the first 30 seconds, 20 popcorns pop. In the next 30 seconds, 60 popcorns pop. In the next 30 seconds, 120 popcorns pop. In the last 30 seconds, 40 popcorns pop. After taking it off the heat, 10 popcorns pop. So 20 + 60 + 120 + 40 + 10 = 250 popcorns. The answer is 250.

Q:

Tim needed 6 lemons to get 1 cup of juice. 4 gallons of lemonade requires 4 * 1 = 4 cups of juice. 4 cups of juice require 4 * 6 = 24 lemons. The answer is 24.

Q:

The kennel house keeps 3 German Shepherds and 2 Bulldogs. Each German Shepherd consumes 5 kg of dog food per day. Each Bulldog consumes 3 kg of dog food per day. So 3 German Shepherds consume 5 * 3 = 15 kg of dog food per day. 2 Bulldogs consume 3 * 2 = 6 kg of dog food per day. So 3 German Shepherds and 2 Bulldogs consume 15 + 6 = 21 kg of dog food per day. 21 kg of dog food per day for 7 days is 21 * 7 = 147 kg of dog food per week. The answer is 147.

Q:

There are 10 2-legged animals and 15 4-legged animals. If all animals are healthy, then there are 10 + 15 = 25 pairs of animal legs. The answer is 25.

Q:

There are 4 blue blocks, twice as many yellow blocks, and an unknown number of red blocks. 4 + 2 * 2 = 8 blue blocks. 8 + 2 * 2 = 12 yellow blocks. And there are 32 blocks in total. 12 + 12 + ? = 32. The answer is 12.

Q:

Elvis started driving from his house and traveled west for 5 hours. Then he turned around and traveled east for 8 hours. 5 hours is 5/6 of a day. 8 hours is 8/6 of a day. So he traveled for 13/6 of a day. 13/6 is 2.16666... hours. The answer is 2.16666... hours.

Q:

Gary bought a boat for $9000. It depreciated by 30% over the first year. It depreciated by 30% again over the second year. It depreciated by 20% over the third year. 9000 * (1/3) ^ 3 = 2700. 2700 * (1/3) ^ 2 = 900. 900 * (1/3) ^ 1 = 300. 300 + 900 + 2700 = 3400. The answer is 3400.

Q:

There are 232 pieces of individually wrapped candies. 54 red candies, twice that amount of orange candies and half as many yellow candies as red candies. So 54 + 2 * 54 = 168 orange candies. 168 / 2 = 84 yellow candies. 84 - 54 = 30 pink candies. The answer is 30.

Q:

Helen paid 80 dollars for the hotel. Every bus trip was 10% of the price of one night at the hotel. So 10% of 80 is 8 dollars. She paid 80 + 8 = 88 dollars for the hotel and bus travels. The answer is 88.

Q:

Mazie had 52 marbles. Dallas had 21 marbles after dropping 4 of them in the playground. So he had 21 - 4 = 17 marbles. Mazie gave Darla 52 - 17 = 35 marbles. The answer is 35.

Q:

They paid $12 for the parent's ticket and $8 for the child's ticket. Then they paid $3 for 2 popcorns. So they paid $12 + $8 + $3 = 23 dollars. The answer is 23.

Q:

John's car weighs 1200 pounds. His luggage weighs 250 pounds. His two young children weigh 75 pounds each. 1% of 1200 + 1% of 250 + 1% of 75 = 12 + 2.5 + 0.75 = 15.25 pounds. The answer is 15.25 pounds.

Q:

James's backyard fence is a rectangle that measures 20 feet on the long side and 15 feet on the short side. So it is 20 * 15 = 300 square feet. To cover the whole fence, he needs 300 / 2 = 150 feet of crepe paper. The answer is 150.

Q:

Mia is younger than Emma. So Mia is 40 years old. Emma is older than Mia by 16 years. So Emma is 56 years old. Their average age is (40 + 56) / 2 = 48. The answer is 48.

Q:

Tom found 214 seashells. Nancy found 432 seashells. Benny found 86 seashells. They cleaned them and found 67 cracked ones. 214 + 432 + 86 - 67 = 701. The answer is 701.

Q:

Avery needs to buy a 3 piece place setting (dinner & salad plate and a bowl).  She's having 12 people over for dinner.  If the dinner plates cost $6.00 each and bowls each cost $5.00 and the salad plates cost $4.00, then 12 * 3 * 6 + 12 * 3 * 5 + 12 * 3 * 4 = 12 * 18 = 216. The answer is 216.

Q:

Steve spent 10 hours working on the puzzle. Anna worked on the puzzle for 2 hours more than half of Steve's time. 10 / 2 = 5. So Anna worked on the puzzle for 5 hours. The answer is 5.

Q:

Dexter started with 5 pigs. Each one eats 4 pounds of feed, twice a day. 5 * 4 * 2 = 40 pounds of feed per day. 40 * 7 = 280 pounds of feed per week. 280 - 300 is -20 pounds of feed. The answer is -20.

Q:

John invited 20 people to a birthday party. Each guest will eat 2 hot dogs. He already has 4 hot dogs left over from a previous party. A pack of hot dogs contains 6 hot dogs. So he needs to buy 20 * 2 * 6 = 120 hot dogs. 120 * 2 = 240 dollars. The answer is 240.

Q:

Frances sold 20 cupcakes for $2 each. That was 20 x 2 = 40 dollars. She also sold 40 cookies for $1 each. That was 40 x 1 = 40 dollars. She bought 5 trays for $4 each. That was 5 x 4 = 20 dollars. So she had 40 + 40 + 20 = 100 dollars. She spent 100 - 100 = 0 dollars. The answer is 0.

Q:

At the start, there were 5 children. Each child was joined by another child. So there were 5 + 2 + 4 = 11 children. Then the original 5 children left. So there were 11 - 5 = 6 children. The answer is 6.

Q:

There were originally 1,360 meals. On Friday, she distributed 64 meals. On Saturday, she distributed 30 meals. On Sunday, she distributed 48 meals. So she has 1,360 - 64 - 30 - 48 = 1,228 meals left. The answer is 1,228.

Q:

James found a quarter, two nickels, and 7 dimes. A quarter is worth 25 cents. Two nickels are worth 10 cents each. 7 dimes are worth 10 cents each. So altogether it is 25 + 10 + 10 + 10 + 10 + 10 + 10 = 75 cents. The answer is 75 cents.

Q:

There are 2 brothers and 3 sisters. All sisters are the same age, which is 16. One of the brothers is 12 years old, which is half the age of the older brother. 16 + 12 = 28. The answer is 28.

Q:

Charisma meditated for 15 minutes every day. She practiced yoga for 1 hour 5 days a week. In 4 weeks, she meditated for 15 minutes * 4 weeks = 60 minutes. She practiced yoga for 1 hour * 5 days * 4 weeks = 20 hours. So she spent 60 + 20 = 80 minutes on meditation and yoga practice. The answer is 80.

Q:

Octavia wants to make a quilt from small, medium, and large t-shirts. Small ones are 3 square feet. Medium ones are 4 square feet. Large ones are 6 square feet. 11 small shirts are 11 * 3 = 33 square feet. 8 medium shirts are 8 * 4 = 32 square feet. 6 large shirts are 6 * 6 = 36 square feet. 33 + 32 + 36 = 101 square feet. The answer is 101.

Q:

A small sunflower has 3 dozen seeds. A large sunflower has 50% more seeds than a small sunflower. 3 * 1.5 = 4.5 dozen seeds. So there are 4.5 dozen seeds altogether. The answer is 4.5.

Q:

Timothy has 3 times the number of pens that George owns. Sarah has half as many pens as Timothy. So if George has 18 pens, then Timothy has 18 * 3 = 54 pens. Sarah has 54 / 2 = 27 pens. The answer is 27.

Q:

Jackie grew 3 inches over the summer. She is now 2 inches shorter than Anne, who is twice the size of Albert. 36 / 2 = 18. 18 + 3 = 21. The answer is 21.

Q:

The company produces 5000 bars in one day. It sells them for $2 each. So it gets $5000 * 2 = $10000. The answer is $10000.

Q:

Jake spent 2 x 8 = 16 dollars on T-shirts. Then he spent 2 x 40 / 1.4 = 28 dollars on shoes. So he spent 16 + 28 = 44 dollars. The answer is 44.

Q:

Ryan's allowance is $6 per week. He completed his chores for 3 weeks. Then he spent $3.75 (3 x 1.25) on ice cream cones. So he had $6 - 3.75 = 2.25 remaining. He wants to buy 6.50 movie tickets. 6.50 / 2.25 = 2.88. The answer is 2.88.

Q:

Ellen spent $100 on leggings and $5 on a photo frame. Lani spent $30 on sunglasses and $200 on two bathrobes. So Ellen spent $105 and Lani spent $205. 105 + 205 = 310. The answer is 310.

Q:

Tim needs 2 pounds of passion fruit, 1.5 pounds of jackfruit, and 2 pounds of special honey. 2 * 1.5 + 2 * 2 + 2 * 2 = 12 pounds. 12 pounds of ingredients cost 2 * 6 + 2 * 8 + 2 * 10 = 60 dollars. 10 jars sell for 50 dollars each. 60 - 500 = -450 dollars. The answer is -450 dollars.

Q:

Justin's jar has 32 quarters, 95 dimes, 120 nickels, and 750 pennies. Each quarter is worth 25 cents. Each dime is worth 10 cents. Each nickel is worth 5 cents. Each penny is worth 1 cent. So the total value is (32 * 25) + (95 * 10) + (120 * 5) + (750 * 1). 32 * 25 is 800. 95 * 10 is 950. 120 * 5 is 600. 750 * 1 is 750. So the total value is 800 + 950 + 600 + 750 = 3100. The answer is 3100.

Q:

Janet spent $3.50 on ice cream, $7.50 each for movie tickets for herself and her younger sister, and $8.50 on a bracelet. So she spent 3.5 + 7.5 + 8.5 = 19.5 dollars. Her parents gave her $40. So she has 40 - 19.5 = 20.5 dollars left. The answer is 20.5.

Q:

Josh works 5 days a week. He makes $4 per car. 5 days a week * 2 weeks = 10 days. 10 days * 3 cars a day = 30 cars. 30 * $4 = $120. The answer is $120.

Q:

Randy started with 9 oatmeal cookies, 4 chocolate chip cookies, and 5 sugar cookies. He ate 3 cookies for an early day snack, one of each flavor. He ate 2 oatmeal cookies for lunch. He gives 2 sugar cookies to his friends. Then, he bakes 4 of each flavor for dinner. So he had 9 + 4 + 5 = 18 cookies before baking. 18 - 3 - 2 - 4 = 11 cookies after baking. The answer is 11.

Q:

Matthew has 12 unique toy soldiers. Each one costs him $5. So he has spent $60. If he sells it for $7 each, he will get $7 * 12 = 84 dollars. So he will make $84 - 60 = 24 dollars. The answer is 24.

Q:

Nate's dog can dig 6 holes a day. He digs for 14 days while Nate is on vacation. When Nate gets home, he starts filling in 9 holes a day, but the dog keeps digging 6 new holes every night. So he fills in 9 + 6 = 15 holes a day. 15 holes a day for 7 days is 15 * 7 = 105 holes filled in. 105 - 14 = 91 holes left. 91 / 6 = 15 weeks. The answer is 15 weeks.

Q:

Norman High School enrolls an average of 4000 students every year. Butler High School enrolls an average of 3/4 as many students as Norman High School. So 4000 / 3/4 = 5000/3 = 1666.666... students per year. So the difference is 4000 - 1666.666... = 2333.333... students per year. The answer is 2333.333... students per year.

Q:

The Adams family made 7995 cookies. They have 2595 rainbow cookies, 3075 oatmeal cookies, and some chocolate chip cookies. So they have 7995 - (2595 + 3075) = 2425 chocolate chip cookies. The answer is 2425.

Q:

Dr. Grumpus asked Igor to gather 16 test tubes, 7 beakers, and 14 Petri dishes. Igor gathered 16 test tubes, 2 more than the number of Petri dishes requested. He also gathered 7 beakers, but lost 2 on the way to the lab bench. So he had 7 - 2 = 5 beakers. The answer is 5.

Q:

James has 40 screws. Each table has 4 legs. Each leg needs 2 screws. So 40 / 4 * 2 = 10 screws will be left over. The answer is 10.

Q:

There are 10 eggs in one basket. In another basket, there are 20 eggs. So there are 10 + 20 = 30 eggs in the other basket. So there are 10 + 30 = 40 eggs in both baskets. The answer is 40.

Q:

Kim raised $320 more than Alexandra. Alexandra raised $430. So Kim raised $320 + 430 = 750. Maryam raised $400 more than Sarah. Sarah raised $300. So Maryam raised $400 + 300 = 700. In total, they raised 750 + 700 = 1450. The answer is 1450.

Q:

Q: There are 15 trees in the grove. Grove workers will plant trees in the grove today. After they are done, there will be 21 trees. How many trees did the grove workers plant today?
A: There are 15 trees originally. Then there were 21 trees after some more were planted. So there must have been 21 - 15 = 6. The answer is 6.

A: There are originally 3 cars. 2 more cars arrive. 3 + 2 = 5. The answer is 5.

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?
A: Originally, Leah had 32 chocolates. Her sister had 42. So in total they had 32 + 42 = 74. After eating 35, they had 74 - 35 = 39. The answer is 39.

Q: There are 15 trees in the grove. Grove workers will plant trees in the grove today. After they are done, there will be 21 trees. How many trees did the grove workers plant today?
A: There are 15 trees originally. Then there were 21 trees after some more were planted. So there must have been 21 - 15 = 6. The answer is 6.

Q: If there are 3 cars in the parking lot and 2 more cars arrive, how many cars are in the parking lot?
A: There are originally 3 cars. 2 more cars arrive. 3 + 2 = 5. The answer is 5.

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?
A: Originally, Leah had 32 chocolates. Her sister had 42. So in total they had 32 + 42 = 74. After eating 35, they had 74 - 35 = 39. The answer is 39.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: Michael had 58 golf balls. On tuesday, he lost 23 golf balls. On wednesday, he lost 2 more. How many golf balls did he have at the end of wednesday?
A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

A: Olivia had 23 dollars. 5 bagels for 3 dollars each will be 5 x 3 = 15 dollars. So she has 23 - 15 dollars left. 23 - 15 is 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?

A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: Michael had 58 golf balls. On tuesday, he lost 23 golf balls. On wednesday, he lost 2 more. How many golf balls did he have at the end of wednesday?
A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?
A: Originally, Leah had 32 chocolates. Her sister had 42. So in total they had 32 + 42 = 74. After eating 35, they had 74 - 35 = 39. The answer is 39.

Q: There are 15 trees in the grove. Grove workers will plant trees in the grove today. After they are done, there will be 21 trees. How many trees did the grove workers plant today?
A: There are 15 trees originally. Then there were 21 trees after some more were planted. So there must have been 21 - 15 = 6. The answer is 6.

Q: There are 15 trees in the grove. Grove workers will plant trees in the grove today. After they are done, there will be 21 trees. How many trees did the grove workers plant today?
A: There are 15 trees originally. Then there were 21 trees after some more were planted. So there must have been 21 - 15 = 6. The answer is 6.

Q: If there are 3 cars in the parking lot and 2 more cars arrive, how many cars are in the parking lot?
A: There are originally 3 cars. 2 more cars arrive. 3 + 2 = 5. The answer is 5.

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?
A: Originally, Leah had 32 chocolates. Her sister had 42. So in total they had 32 + 42 = 74. After eating 35, they had 74 - 35 = 39. The answer is 39.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?
A: Originally, Leah had 32 chocolates. Her sister had 42. So in total they had 32 + 42 = 74. After eating 35, they had 74 - 35 = 39. The answer is 39.

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: Michael had 58 golf balls. On tuesday, he lost 23 golf balls. On wednesday, he lost 2 more. How many golf balls did he have at the end of wednesday?
A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: Michael had 58 golf balls. On tuesday, he lost 23 golf balls. On wednesday, he lost 2 more. How many golf balls did he have at the end of wednesday?
A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?
A: Originally, Leah had 32 chocolates. Her sister had 42. So in total they had 32 + 42 = 74. After eating 35, they had 74 - 35 = 39. The answer is 39.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?
A: Originally, Leah had 32 chocolates. Her sister had 42. So in total they had 32 + 42 = 74. After eating 35, they had 74 - 35 = 39. The answer is 39.

Q: Michael had 58 golf balls. On tuesday, he lost 23 golf balls. On wednesday, he lost 2 more. How many golf balls did he have at the end of wednesday?
A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

Q: Olivia has $23. She bought five bagels for $3 each. How much money does she have left?
A: Olivia had 23 dollars. 5 bagels for 3 dollars each will be 5 x 3 = 15 dollars. So she has 23 - 15 dollars left. 23 - 15 is 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Olivia has $23. She bought five bagels for $3 each. How much money does she have left?
A: Olivia had 23 dollars. 5 bagels for 3 dollars each will be 5 x 3 = 15 dollars. So she has 23 - 15 dollars left. 23 - 15 is 8. The answer is 8.

Q: There are 15 trees in the grove. Grove workers will plant trees in the grove today. After they are done, there will be 21 trees. How many trees did the grove workers plant today?
A: There are 15 trees originally. Then there were 21 trees after some more were planted. So there must have been 21 - 15 = 6. The answer is 6.

A: There are originally 3 cars. 2 more cars arrive. 3 + 2 = 5. The answer is 5.

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?
A: Originally, Leah had 32 chocolates. Her sister had 42. So in total they had 32 + 42 = 74. After eating 35, they had 74 - 35 = 39. The answer is 39.

Q: Olivia has $23. She bought five bagels for $3 each. How much money does she have left?
A: Olivia had 23 dollars. 5 bagels for 3 dollars each will be 5 x 3 = 15 dollars. So she has 23 - 15 dollars left. 23 - 15 is 8. The answer is 8.

Q: There are 15 trees in the grove. Grove workers will plant trees in the grove today. After they are done, there will be 21 trees. How many trees did the grove workers plant today?

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?
A: Originally, Leah had 32 chocolates. Her sister had 42. So in total they had 32 + 42 = 74. After eating 35, they had 74 - 35 = 39. The answer is 39.

Q: Michael had 58 golf balls. On tuesday, he lost 23 golf balls. On wednesday, he lost 2 more. How many golf balls did he have at the end of wednesday?
A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

Q: There are 15 trees in the grove. Grove workers will plant trees in the grove today. After they are done, there will be 21 trees. How many trees did the grove workers plant today?
A: There are 15 trees originally. Then there were 21 trees after some more were planted. So there must have been 21 - 15 = 6. The answer is 6.

Q: If there are 3 cars in the parking lot and 2 more cars arrive, how many cars are in the parking lot?
A: There are originally 3 cars. 2 more cars arrive. 3 + 2 = 5. The answer is 5.

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?
A: Originally, Leah had 32 chocolates. Her sister had 42. So in total they had 32 + 42 = 74. After eating 35, they had 74 - 35 = 39. The answer is 39.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?

Q: Michael had 58 golf balls. On tuesday, he lost 23 golf balls. On wednesday, he lost 2 more. How many golf balls did he have at the end of wednesday?
A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

Q: Olivia has $23. She bought five bagels for $3 each. How much money does she have left?
A: Olivia had 23 dollars. 5 bagels for 3 dollars each will be 5 x 3 = 15 dollars. So she has 23 - 15 dollars left. 23 - 15 is 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: Michael had 58 golf balls. On tuesday, he lost 23 golf balls. On wednesday, he lost 2 more. How many golf balls did he have at the end of wednesday?
A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: Michael had 58 golf balls. On tuesday, he lost 23 golf balls. On wednesday, he lost 2 more. How many golf balls did he have at the end of wednesday?
A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: Michael had 58 golf balls. On tuesday, he lost 23 golf balls. On wednesday, he lost 2 more. How many golf balls did he have at the end of wednesday?
A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

Q: If there are 3 cars in the parking lot and 2 more cars arrive, how many cars are in the parking lot?
A: There are originally 3 cars. 2 more cars arrive. 3 + 2 = 5. The answer is 5.

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?
A: Originally, Leah had 32 chocolates. Her sister had 42. So in total they had 32 + 42 = 74. After eating 35, they had 74 - 35 = 39. The answer is 39.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

Q: Olivia has $23. She bought five bagels for $3 each. How much money does she have left?
A: Olivia had 23 dollars. 5 bagels for 3 dollars each will be 5 x 3 = 15 dollars. So she has 23 - 15 dollars left. 23 - 15 is 8. The answer is 8.

A: There are originally 3 cars. 2 more cars arrive. 3 + 2 = 5. The answer is 5.

Q: Leah had 32 chocolates and her sister had 42. If they ate 35, how many pieces do they have left in total?
A: Originally, Leah had 32 chocolates. Her sister had 42. So in total they had 32 + 42 = 74. After eating 35, they had 74 - 35 = 39. The answer is 39.

Q: Michael had 58 golf balls. On tuesday, he lost 23 golf balls. On wednesday, he lost 2 more. How many golf balls did he have at the end of wednesday?
A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

A: Olivia had 23 dollars. 5 bagels for 3 dollars each will be 5 x 3 = 15 dollars. So she has 23 - 15 dollars left. 23 - 15 is 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.

Q: Shawn has five toys. For Christmas, he got two toys each from his mom and dad. How many toys does he have now?
A: Shawn started with 5 toys. If he got 2 toys each from his mom and dad, then that is 4 more toys. 5 + 4 = 9. The answer is 9.

Q: There were nine computers in the server room. Five more computers were installed each day, from monday to thursday. How many computers are now in the server room?
A: There were originally 9 computers. For each of 4 days, 5 more computers were added. So 5 * 4 = 20 computers were added. 9 + 20 is 29. The answer is 29.

Q: Michael had 58 golf balls. On tuesday, he lost 23 golf balls. On wednesday, he lost 2 more. How many golf balls did he have at the end of wednesday?
A: Michael started with 58 golf balls. After losing 23 on tuesday, he had 58 - 23 = 35. After losing 2 more, he had 35 - 2 = 33 golf balls. The answer is 33.

Q: Jason had 20 lollipops. He gave Denny some lollipops. Now Jason has 12 lollipops. How many lollipops did Jason give to Denny?
A: Jason started with 20 lollipops. Then he had 12 after giving some to Denny. So he gave Denny 20 - 12 = 8. The answer is 8.
